0/1 Star: meter parking and even that might be hard to find during the day. This place is small and fills up on cold days, and sadly on these cold days you need to wait outside in the cold because there is no indoor waiting area. 
_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

0/1 Star: rude owner. Chairs, table, menu, everything feels dirty. Everything is questionable. I don't dare check if they have a bathroom because I don't want to see how it looks like in the back or kitchen. 
_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: Even with bad parking, bad service, and questionable cleanliness, this place is Must Try! Their BBQ Pho is amazing! I wish more places would make something like this! Nice servings for the price. The BBQ shrimp and pork are really good. If your willing to throw some into your broth, it gets even better! In my mind there are good Pho places, and there is this BBQ Pho place. 
_____

Overall Experience

3/5 Stars 
_____

Pictures


_____

Last Words

Great food, poor everything else.
author: Elliott N.

description:
This place is so cheap. Like 4$ for a bowl of pho cheap. Let me tell you, it is a bang for your buck. But definitely do not expect a clean place or good service.

The food itself to me, is pretty darn good. The broth is one of my favorites and I grew up in a Vietnamese household eating pho. When I crave pho, I always want to come here haha..

LOL, but this definitely isn't a place to bring your date to, cause it's cramped and dirty!

The food is just so yum and the price / portions are so hard to pass up!
author: Mel T.

description:
This place probably has the cheapest pho up and down Iriving Street. Here's the catch, it is a small place, and I have to admit it is not one of the cleanest. You might be disgusted the first time if you haven't been to a third-world country before. 

DO NOT COME HERE IN A GROUP OF 4+, they probably only have enough seats for 25 people. 

I've been coming here since I was a kid. The prices slightly went up due to inflation. But what do you expect? 

The quality of the food is great especially for the price you're paying. To me, it tastes better than Kevins (between 19th and 20th Ave.). The waiters aren't as rude either. Fast service.
author: Jess W.

description:
Pho is excellent here! The broth is delicious and is not super oily. The bowl ranges from medium to extra large. There is a problem, this is such a tiny place, so don't expect to sit for long. You come here for pho, not to carry out a long conversation. Although this is a negative side, the prices make up for it! You can get a bowl of pho for less than 4 bucks! Where can you get that? No where! 

If you want cheap and delicious pho, give Loi's a try!
author: Sappho C.

description: Bad idea that I had come here and eat. I'm super hungry and I wanna have a quick meal when I came to this place. The place is small, I got seated, I ordered. She walks away. Then suddenly,  she didn't get my order clearly, so she shouted and ask me again my order, while all the people in the restaurant look at me and too bad to say, but I need to yell my order again. I got my food.. i am having a couple spoonfuls of food, then a group of 4 people came in. Funny thing is I have a spacious table for four.. so she looks at my strange and literally ask me to move to other table. I  stand up, holding my plate and utensils, and cup while eating, to accommodate these people, with constant apologies. I'm drying out my mouth, the small tea cup is out already, need water and go. I'm still nice, I leave good tips.. but tell me do u think it deserves one star review according to what I experienced?
author: Calvin Nicholei L.

description: This is classic simple food. I'm not a big eggroll fan (they're generally greasy and tasteless), but these are tremendous. The combo plates are generous in size and the meat is really tasty. In terms of service, they're efficient and no frills. I'm fine with having to squeeze between two people cooking to get to the bathroom--if this bothers you, there are a zillion more foofy places you can go in SF. I've been coming here forever and think it's a great neighborhood gem.
author: Peter B.

description:
Cheap pho? Yes please. 

You get what you pay for here. A small restaurant that serves around $5 per bowl for pho. The pho in my opinion is decent since it's quite cheap. The soup is very flavorful which is a little too much for me. Other than that, I'll come back here for something quick and cheap. 

Service on the other hand.. Not the best. Would've been a four star from me but service definitely dropped it. You kind of have to be loud and obnoxious to catch their attention. If not, they will ignore you until they notice you not eating for like 10 mins. I've wanted my bill and never got it until 5 mins later.
author: Vernice T.

description:
First time here and I really enjoyed this place. It's quite small and the customer service may not be the best, but their food is good. 

I have the BBQ beef vermicelli with egg rolls. I thought that the meat was good, unfortunately it had a gasoline flavor due to the way they bbq their meat. The egg rolls were yummy and crispy. Did I mention this dish was only $5.50?

The beau had the pho and it was yummy too. Something about their meat, it was nice and chewy and flavorful. 

Their bathroom is a bit of a squeeze to get to. It's behind their kitchen, so you'll have to go through the back. Their kitchen is quite small, but it's amazing what they can do in such a small space. 

Would I come back? Heck yeah.
author: Mandy D.

description: Every time I'm broke and desperately starving I go here. When I order Pho, I say "There goes Loi, there goes Loi." Because he seems to love putting his thumbs in my soup as he comes to serve me. He puts his thumbs when he holds the bowl so be careful.  Don't order chicken because I ordered chicken pho and it still had little feathers in my chicken pho. KFC is down the corner and their chicken seems feather free....
author: Lashondraneesha W.

description:
I dunno where to begin. 
Oh, I know, how about I start talking about the 4 mangy cats I saw drinking water and eating random stuff right next to, practically inside, the kitchen? If you go to the bathroom/kitchen area, and you look over to your right, there's this door that leads to an alleyway. Well, it looks like that's a spot where they either clean vegetables or wash their dishes... Well, there were dirty cats out there; all up on the strainers and pots and whatnot.. gross. 

Well, ok. Let's just kinda fool ourselves and pretend that's where the garbage goes. Food should be good right?? 

Wrong. 

I kept finding hair in my number 1 extra-large (you can go see the photos I posted). One hair I found, well, it looks like cat hair... I had cats before, I know what cat hair looks like - for example, it's dark at the tips, light in the middle, and dark again... you know, animal hair. 

I wanted to like them cuz they're a family joint.. but damn... for realz? I'm half thinking about reporting them to the HHS or CDC or something. 

Am I over reacting? Go in, go to the bathroom area and have a look around...
author: Garland W.

description:
My friends and I come here all time favorite place to go for pho. The owner may seem rude at times but he is very kind (at least to me). 
They work hard for such a small place!!
author: Cleo C.

description: Love this place, reminds me of my mama's cooking. Best bun rien in the city (but second to mama's).
author: M P.

description:
honestly, this was one of my favorite pho place before, its cheap and good. All my friends would used to always bash on how nasty the place and food are and rumors like they put meats next to the bathroom because its super small in the kitchen, but i didnt care. I went again today, It really pissed me off.. when the guy ( boss i think) came to my table and gave me water i told him i wanted #1, he totally ignored what i said.. well i didnt care cause hes been always rude and always had his black face on him. Then when i finished my pho, i was going to  AA the bills with my friend but i had a $20, so i wanted to BREAK IT.. he was like "No, go discuss changes with your friends" and he gave me $9 back because the bill was $11. LIKE TF HE WAS SUPER RUDE AND HAD NO RIGHT TO DO THAT... 

customer service : BAD
author: amy l.

description:
I came here many years ago with my brother and remembered it being an interesting meal, but not something I liked.

I returned last Sunday to try it out again with my brother and this time I was blown away.

I lived in the South Bay all my life, and the vast majority of the Pho restaurants in San Jose are owned and operated by folks from the south of Vietnam.  I grew accustomed to our style of pho, as it was also the style my mom makes.  After moving to SF, my eyes have been opened to the cuisine of the rest of the country.

This pho place seems to specialized in northern Vietnamese style pho.  

I ordered the bbq chicken and bbq pork pho.  This was a trip because these meats are usually not eaten with pho, but man it was stupid good.  They brought out the pho and at first I was like, wtf there's no meat! Then out came this giant plate of meat. The pork was fatty and tender, the 5 spiced bbq chicken was expertly cooked and so moist.  

I dipped the meat in the pho broth and chowed down.  My brother and I were having a hearty discussion about reefing and fish, but we immediately shut up and gobbled our food.

By the end, after dipping all the meat in the broth, the broth had turned into a sweet, salty orgy of flavors.

I will definitely come here again, braving the fog for some of the best pho I've had in the city.
author: Tu T.

description:
this is definitely a dirty local's place

cheap pho ($4), delicious, vermicilli was good as well, yummy bbq chicken,
author: Long C.

description:
Once again, this place is not for everybody. IF you're picky about restaurant sanitation then you'd probably need to reconsider. IF you prefer to use the bathroom during your visit then you'd probably need to reconsider. IF you're that person who loves to takes a million photos when trying a restaurant for the first time, then you'd probably need to reconsider. AND IF you rate decor and service at Vietnamese Pho places, you must be crazy..

For those who are still reading, Loi's offers a sense of authenticity that many places nowadays seem to lack. They've been in business way before Yelp was even developed and is still managed by the family who started this business long ago. The old man who is perceived as rude and hasty has a great sense of humor if you can relate, while the lady is just the most polite Asian lady you would probably meet. 

As for the food, they're good at what they do. The pho manages to speak to the soul while their spring rolls are as fresh as they come. The portions are generous and it comes with a price that can't be beat ($6 for an XL!? Are we in 2002?). Like I said Loi's isn't for everyone, but for those that keep going back, we're surely glad that they haven't changed one bit.
author: Ricky F.

description:
Place looks dirty, scary and the bathroom is the same thing. So, pee beforehand, don't use the bathroom here. I'm all about hole in the walls but Loi's seriously tries my ability to do anything for food. Bring your own anti-bacterial wipes, you'll thank me later.

I can't even begin to understand how in the world this place is staying afloat with the extremely low prices that they charge in SF. Super super cheap food, not even bad food. Relatively good food.

Honestly, this place is more Chinese than Vietnamese, even their pho has a hint of the Eastern Asian flavors, but they make it work! The grilled plates smell delectable as it comes out from the kitchen, all the soups were flavorful and piping hot. But with most Asian hole in the walls, it's best not to ask how clean any of your food really is or where it comes from.

Just know that you're getting what you're paying for!
Why 3 stars and not 4? It's seriously just the cleanliness issue. I didn't feel particularly clean. Maybe it was just that day?
author: Winè C.

description:
I don't usually post reviews but this one is a must.  We ordered the BBQ shrimp & pork over rice noodles halfway through the meal my daughter found a short strand of black hair in her bowl.  I don't like making a scene so we quietly told the short guy but he rudely walked away with my daughter's food & when he came back he started talking loudly in what I thought was Chinese & slammed the check on our table.  I was waiting for the waiter to apologize but he kept yelling in his language & No apologies so I said all you have to say is sorry but instead he yelled at us to leave & took our money.  If only I could give negative stars I would.

I get it ok, It's a hole in the wall & you get what you pay for but come on now, hair in our food & the yelling!
author: Gladys M.

description:
There are only two reasons why I do yelp reviews: when I am insanely bored or I encountered a horrible experience at a business. Sadly for this restaurant, it was the latter.

SERVICE SUCKS. The waiter basically ignored my friend who wanted water. In addition, when we paid, he was in such a hurry to snatch our money that he even went off without grabbing all the money (left the 20 dollar bill). When he came back for it, he had the audacity  to yell in Chinese how we took 20 mins as he walked away. Uhhh, excuse me now? WE DIDN'T TAKE 20 MINS TO PAY THE DAMN BILL, DRAMA QUEEN. Too damn rude. 

In addition, friend found hair in his pho and the plastic cups were dirty. Yuck and yuck.
author: Kirsten H.

description:
My go to pho spot! Good and distinct flavors at even a better price (less than $5). I'll give my sanitary habits a break for this hole-in-the-wall restaurant for their great food. 

The ultimate pho experience.
author: Shelby C.

description:
I can't figure out the soup base! It just does not taste like pho...

Good thing is, this place is hella cheap.
#1 Large & #2 Medium = $9

Also, I discovered the tiny little flat screen sort of above the door.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Nothing much to say about this place. Great food cheap price so I'm not complaining about the not-so-great location :) five stars from me
author: Aparajita C.

description:
Where the hell in San Francisco can you find a $5.50 to fulfill your stomach? Especially a bowl of Pho? Banh Pho Tuoi some more (homemade fresh Pho noodle).

It's just too awesome to complain. All prices are reasonable and I just can't stop myself from coming here. 

The only down side to me is service is slower than I expected. But still 5 stars for Mr.Loi!
author: Logan T.

description:
HOLE IN THE WALL.

DIRT CHEAP! oh how I love finding places like this! Loi's is not about the ambiance, not about how clean it is, and all about the food!
I get dry pho from here, that is when I don't wanna go all the way to TL for 25 dry and other spots. They have dry pho here and their portion is so big! I also had rice plate here too! it's very delicious! 

Like I warn my friends, don't use the bathroom before or during the meal. Use it after!
Enjoy! xoxo
author: Mindy C.

description:
Somewhere between 3 and 4 stars.  I'm so torn because the food was CHEAP and delicious but the restaurant is on the dirty side...not to mention there was a bum eating here when I came..and he smelled so bad it made my nose burn.

$4.75 for a medium bowl of bun rieu, $5.85 for a large bowl.  HOW IS THAT POSSIBLE?!  The broth was flavorful but not as rich as I would have liked it to be.  I still feel like Green Bamboo and PPQ on Irving have the best bun rieu in SF.  The bowl is full of noodles as well!  Only thing missing for me was tofu.

Would come back again with friends if they wanted to eat here but Loi's wouldn't be at the top of my personal list of places to get Vietnamese food.
author: Steph D.

description: A quick & cheap fix for pho! The best combination for my boyfriend and I is the phos + spring rolls + cold vietnamese coffees, all for less than $20 for two people! Cant find anywhere else.
author: Alice L.

description: Decent portion and inexpensive, but owner will attempt to scam you, so do double check your bill. Service is typically horrific. Owner behaves as though he's had it with life.
author: Ryan C.

description:
This place was my go-to pho place when I was in college and when I lived in sunset. As a broke ass college student, I didn't care how I was served. As long as the food is decent and cheap, I am a fan. 

After my last two years of college in LA, I went back to Loi's this last weekend with my boyfriend. Let me tell you this, the experience was totally different. The service is horrific. I sat with two different parties. There were flies. The BBQ pork I ordered had more fat than the actual meat. What I did appreciate out of all the terrible things was food. And maybe it's because I got to eat the whole bowl by myself and not have to share with two different parties and I didn't need to deal with the service when I was eating? 

I went there during the lunch rush. Loi was so cranky! Go there while they aren't busy.
author: Fong C.

description:
I've been to many restaurants. This is one of the worst. You pay them money to order to go and they give you garbage. Ordered the noddle with egg rolls and add money to get one more egg roll and only received one. Now I can stay and argue with them over one egg roll or just forget about it. When I finally got home the noodles are soggy and so are the egg roll. It's not editable.  I really don't know how one would get what they pay for in restaurants like these.

I think the problems is that the place is small and they have more customers than they can handle so they selectively pick who they choose to give good service or not.

I've been to many restaurants and one of the main reason why they give bad service is that they have too much customers.

Here is a tip. If you found a good restaurant/place don't tell people about it or else the restaurant will turn bad really quick, since they no longer value your business.

I'm surprised how long this place managed to stay open. They been around for quite a while.

Also this place is dirty. Seats and tables are sticky and the floor seemed like you could actually slip. The cleanliness of this place is questionable.
author: Robin T236532i9 W.

description:
I wish I had tried a more traditional pho for my first time here. Instead, I got the tomato beef stew noodle. It was too oily for my taste and they don't have any beef tendons here! The broth is not drinkable by itself because of all the fatty oil. The beef stew was pretty tender, but the bowl of noodles as a whole just didn't convince me as a fan of this place.

Although, I am not brushing off this place yet. I'm willing to give this place another try when I'm in the neighborhood. The restaurant is decently small and definitely not into the decor of the place.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I've gone here quite a few times, read carefully and I will give you the breakdown:
Pros:
You'll never find pho cheaper than this place. 
With tax and tip it's about 5 -6 dollars. 
Great for all of you trying to save money in sf.
Cons: 
The pho itself is pretty good sized, but the soup tastes a little strange compared to most pho restaurants. 
Additionally, it's a hole in the wall and its not the cleanest place as mentioned in most other reviews.
If it's crowded and you're a group of two you might be sitting at a table that there's another group of two, I know it sucks but the important part is eating and not having to pay big.

Important things to note: 
If you or a friend you go with can speak Chinese or Vietnamese have them order for you/anyone else you're with that only knows how to speak English.
In addition, don't go here with a big crowd, stick to 3-4 people max, and (especially in a group of 4) avoid any conversations with the staff other than ordering and paying, trust me it'll be less hassle and if you've already read other reviews on this place my advice is to order, eat, pay.
They are not opened on Wednesdays, so plan ahead. 
The best time of the day to go is within the hour that they open. 
It's cash only, if you're in a pair/group take note of how much your meal was and add a dollar to your total and you should be fine, DO NOT I repeat DO NOT make a big deal about splitting the check multiple ways, it's not worth the hassle in the same way that I said avoid any unnecessary conversations with the staff. 
The price for the smaller pho used to be 3.95, they now raised it to 4.75, which is still within reason. 

Overall if you don't care about the presentation and you care about price this place isn't bad. 
TL; DR? - small group of 4 or less, have one who speaks Chinese/or Viet order for you, order, eat, pay (cash only) and don't converse with staff other than that. Follow this and you should have a better experience than those who don't.
author: Kandice G.

description: Food is alright ... $6.75 what can you ask for more ? But the a$$hole owner is very rude ... You can't ask for more stuff from him beside ask for the check .. And their bowl and sauce plate is kind of dirty *friendly reminder *
author: Kevin K.

description:
I'm usually very generous with my ratings, this is my lowest rating yet. I don't even know where to begin! 

Today, I came in here to eat with my group of friends. The rude owner guy tells me (he was so loud he was practically yelling at me) that I can't sit with them and he points to a separate table for me to sit alone to eat because the table we got was short one seat. OBVIOUSLY I'm with my group of friends yet he still wants to single me out and make me eat alone at a separate table. My friends were shocked that the rude owner had the audacity to yell at and single out one person from the party like that. He was so mean I actually felt like crying from being treated like that.

After he walks away, I grab an extra chair and join my group of friends at their table again and call him over so I can order. While I was placing my order, he gave me the stank eye like I was one of the many filthy flies flying around in his filthy restaurant, he looked pissed because I disobeyed his orders to sit separately from my friends. 

The vietnamese spring rolls that I got were practically swimming in grease, the owner probably spat in it too, because he threw it down on the table angrily. In the middle of the meal, the wooden bar and curtain behind my friend fell out of no where, luckily no one got hurt. The owner did not even apologize.

I swear this place is a hole in the wall waiting to cave in any second. And then near the end of the meal, a huge monster fly landed in my friends pho--this also happened to my other friend last time we came here. But hey, you get what you pay for, a bowl of pho is only $5. Bottom line is, YOU DESERVE BETTER. I would happily pay an extra $3-$5 to eat at other pho places with nicer service, clean utensils, and quality food. 

The only reason I'm not giving them one star is because their prices are literally DIRT cheap so I shouldn't expect quality food or service. And the wife of the rude guy owner is actually a nice lady.
author: Cindy L.

description:
The cheapest pho place I have ever seen!

For a little hole-in-the-wall type of joint, their menu is decently extensive.  Beyond the usual suspects you'd expect to find, I like how they also offer pho with grilled meat instead of the usual sort of combinations.  So rather than getting it with like rare flank steak, tripe, beef balls, etc., you can just get a bowl of plain pho with a generous portion of bbq meat on the side.  Definitely don't see that available at most places, and it's good for people who may be a little torn on getting a bbq meat rice plate or pho.  And seeing as how I find myself in that situation from time to time, kudos to them for offering a solution to both of my cravings in one meal!

Besides that though, the biggest draw to the place are their prices - I don't think they've changed much, if at all, since they first opened.  And from the looks of some of those tattered menus, that was a long ass time ago! I can't remember the exact prices, but a large bowl of the reguar combination pho runs for about $6.  That's it...$6!  Seeing as how most charge $8 or more, that bit of savings can really add up...especially considering how often some of my friends and I get pho!  And if you do the math...two dollar savings  x  (each time I get Loi's pho)  =  more money for more pho!

Unfortunately, as much as I like the place, there are parts to it that leave much to be desired - particularly the service.  I never expect much beyond "acceptable" at divey Asian restaurants, but the waiter can be a little rude at times.  The place is pretty small, so with table space limited, they'll be pretty swift in trying to turn tables over when the line outside start to form.  While that's completely understandable, it's a bit much when he brings you back your tab and stands there next to you waiting for you to sign the slip or calculate the tip.

All in all, even considering the service, Loi's can definitely offer up a decent value for the money.  The broth is flavorful, the servings are pretty generous, and the prices are super reasonable.  As long as you aren't shy about questionable service, cramp spaces, and semi-dirty tables (five second doesn't apply here...or ever really), you'll probably like this place.  And if you don't, then just keep reminding yourself...it was only $6.
author: Mike L.

description:
definitely HOLE in the wall, very small restaurant we did not know existed until we looked it up on yelp. This place is rustic, with old wooden tables and greasy floors. However, its all about the priority of food and service when it comes to rating a restaurant. in my book that is :)

charboiled pork spring roll:  D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!

their Bun Rieu- crab and pork noodle soup: is YUMMY. The taste is traditionally good and orginal.. soft taste of crabby eggy taste with tomatoes lingering in your taste buds. i have tried a few viet restaurants here in the city which serve bun rieu is by far this has the best taste... maybe next time i can ask them to put pork blood on it which will give it more flavor. 

their grilled chicken pho was alright.. they give you a BIG price of grilled chicken and a bowl of soup and rice noodles. i think the broth could have been a little more saltier or more seasoned, it was some what bland,, but i guess you can always add your table sauces and condiments to it?

id definitely come back here again, especially when im craving bun rieu!
author: Steve S.

description:
Today, I made my second visit to Loi's Vietnamese Restaurant.  I went in around 2:00 p.m. on a Saturday for lunch and was lucky enough to get a table for four.  If you've never been there, Loi's is a really tiny place with maybe about 8 tables.  Both times I have come, I've been lucky and not had to wait for a seat.

The menus are located at each of the tables, so once you sit down, you can start deciding.  Everything is super cheap here!  I think it is because they haven't changed the prices haven't changed since whenever they first opened.  The menu is pretty standard for a Vietnamese restaurant.  The last time I went, I ordered a basic combination pho and an order of egg rolls.  But today, with the recommendation of my Vietnamese friends, I ordered the Bun Rieu.  This isn't on the menu, but there is a 8.5x11 print out taped to the wall advertising this special.  For those unfamiliar with what this is, it is a rice vermicelli soup.  The broth is tomato-y and has shrimp/crab paste (very tasty!).  I think it is topped with pork (?).  To me, it sort of tastes like spaghetti and meatballs, in a soup form.  

Anyway, all four of us ordered this dish and all four of us thought it was delicious.  A medium sized bowl will cost $4.75, a large cost $5.25 and the extra large is just a little bit more.  My friend and I actually shared a large and it was plenty to feed the both of us.  

Overall, Loi's Vietnamese Restaurant cranks out delicious food at cheap prices.  The restaurant is not very fancy, but it's sufficiently clean and  it's very casual.  All of your napkins, utensils, sauces, (and menus) are already located at your table.  The waitress quickly brings you complimentary tea and they take your order quickly too.  Within 5 minutes, you'll be enjoying your food!  I will most likely be back soon.

Notes:
-Parking in the area may be difficult.  There are metered spaces in front, or free street parking on the side streets. 
-Try the Bun Rieu!
author: Samantha L.

description:
hole in a wall, underrated, CHEAP!
pros : big bowl of pho for cheap! 6-7 $ for a Large pho!  Very good egg rolls
cons : slow service, and DIRTY. CASH ONLY
author: Jared Z.

description: I'm sorry, if you come to this place looking for service and hygiene, you need Jesus.
author: Alex S.

description:
HORRENDOUS experience!

First off, this place is filthy. I almost left right after walking in because of the amount of flies there. Unfortunately, I decided to stay. I've never felt so unwelcome in a restaurant before. I'm sitting there looking over the menu and the old man (owner?) asks if I'm ready to order. I say no, and ask him for a glass of water. He let's out this huge sigh, gives me this crazy look like I'm making some outrageous demand and walks away. He comes back to take my order (still no water) and before he walks away he demands that I put the menu back behind the napkin dispenser. I say, "Ok I will," thinking he'd just walk away. No, he stood there to watch me actually tuck it behind the napkins on the table. I kid you not. 

He finally brings me a Dixie cup of water along with my food. Yup, a Dixie cup. I had ordered the beef stew (#3) and it was just disgusting. It was just bones, lots of sinew, fat, and noodles in a bowl. No beef whatsoever and the broth was bland. 

Do yourself a favor and eat at Pho Kim Son on Balboa & 37th Ave instead of this dump.

The service at Pho Kim Son is great (very friendly & attentive,) the restaurant is very clean, and they have the best Vietnamese food in SF! I think Mr. Loi could learn a thing or two from them about how to properly run a restaurant. Just sayin' ...
author: Emanuel C.

description:
This review is a little overdue as my girlfriend and I had lunch here about 10 days ago. For the price we paid, I would say the food was pretty good but I wished they had the Vietnamese chili garlic sauce. 

The place was very noisy because everyone who worked there talked really loud (especially the male server).
author: Jun N.

description:
This place has not changed their prices in over 15 years.  Same menu.  Same prices.  Unbeatable value.  Very small but if the food inspector is good with it so am I.  You have to say "behind you" to the cooks as you squeak through the kitchen to use the pisser.  These guys are lifers.  Don't listen to the haters of this place.  Get the bbq pork bun (noodles cold with hot grilled pork) and party on.
The most expensive menu item is under 8 bucks!
author: Johnny B.

description: Some people have mentioned that the soup is "different" than other Pho places. I would say the broth is different because it's much better. Above average in fact. In addition, the VERY reasonable price affords this place 4 stars in my book. A cheap lunch for six dollars. You simply CANNOT beat that.  However, I should mention that the tables are sticky and damp all the time. They seem to use the same unwashed rag to wipe the table clean. Because the rag is not cleaned or changed frequently, it leaves behind a sticky unpleasant smelling film on the table that actually stinks up the whole restaurant. Otherwise, I try to duck in here for a quick lunch at least twice a week.
author: Mike H.

description:
Food: Pretty standard Vietnamese pho and rice plates. The XL pho is very filling for you binge eaters. There's actually a lot of noodles instead of soup like other places. I always get the #1. Can't go wrong with any decision if you are not picky. 

Service: Couple senior waiters for a very small space. Limited English but friendly. Gets very crowded and you may have to share a table. 

Atmosphere: not uncommon for single eaters or to-go. I'd go with max party of 4. Get in and out.
author: Darrin H.

description: Do not eat anything fried. Their oil is dirty like motor oil. Just look at the oil that remains on the plate... It was gray/ brown! So nasty.  I usually get pho but came with family to share a bite. Heard that the main cook is not around, so its less sanitary. Tables are sticky, flies sometimes around, and the owner can be mean...but that doesn't deter me like their food did today. Seriously, someone from the health dept should do an inspection.
author: Luna L.

description:
This place is one of my got-to restaurants when I'm craving pho. It has really good food for a much cheaper price compared to other places. But it only deserves three stars because of the lacking customer service. Last week when I took my friends there, we got carried away in our conversation and forgot to order. The owner got impatient and started yelling something so we took the hint that he wanted us to place our order.
I was pretty agitated by that but I think I would still consider going back for the cheap prices and good food.
author: Maggie W.

description: Cheap pho! The only place in San Francisco that sells pho that is this cheap and good for its price!!
author: Rafferty L.

description:
Only 4.75 for a medium size pho, and it  was very tasty due to the high amounts of MSG. I was incredibly thirsty afterward! Good amount of beef. The given basil was kind of damaged though. 

Service was terrible! They didn't seat me right away so I finally had to walk up to a waiter. Also, the waiters were practically shouting at each other. You won't be able to have a profound conversation with your buddy there. The old man was a very rude waiter. Also they never came back to my table after serving my dish, to check if I needed more water, and it took forever with the bill.
author: Tes Y.

description:
I love this place. The food is fantastic: BBQ beef w/rice or beef stew noodle soup= awesome! 
The only reasons they don't have 5 stars: I'm scared to go to their bathroom (I vaguely remember trying to find it years ago, but have blocked the memory), and the waiter/owner is cranky. Funny-cranky, but still, the Ritz this ain't.
author: Kris F.

description:
Food: 
Very tasty and fresh. While not the highest quality or the best presentation, it was cheap. For the price, you got alot of food. We had two entrees and an order of the egg rolls, still made it out of there for less than $20. nothing was over seasoned. egg rolls were hot, large and crispy.  the quality of the meat was better than expected, i didnt see chunks of fat on any of the meat from low quality cuts of meat. this is one of those hole in a wall places that you just have to come back because everything is just good enough for the price. nothing too special but nothing too unique.

Atmosphere:
well its a cheap place. it has a street vendor feel too it.  things are relatively clean and well lit. theres not much service here but the lady who served us was nice.  menus look old including the pricing. 

Replay Value:
High, ill come back here just for some cheap eats. this place wont gross you out like other cheap asian places. in my book viet restaurants know how to run cheap eats.
author: Jason C.

description:
My friend introduced me to this place because he heard the pho is really good here, yet very cheap. I usually don't eat pho if it's not Turtle Tower or in San Jose, but I tried this place anyways to see what the hoopla was about.

Came here one afternoon and got seated right away. We both ordered the bun rieu (crab meat noodle soup) and got it probably 5-7 minutes later. It's probably the best bun rieu I've ever tasted, and it's cheap! A large bowl was around $5-6. The bill ended up to be like $11. I was amazed on how cheap it was! I haven't tried anything else here, but the bun rieu is AMAZING. Totally recommend!

This restaurant is very small, so expect to share a table with other people on crowded nights. There was an instance where a lady found a bug in her pho and the guy who works there started yelling at her, saying it was garlic or something along those lines. It was my first time there too, but I was just glad that it wasn't my bowl of pho. I think parking is easy to find around here.
author: Vivian L.

description:
One of those hole-in-the-wall places that my friend brings me to whenever we crave vietnamese. The restaurant is small but we usually get seated quickly. 

Their proportions for the price is so worth it, it will not break your wallet whatsoever!

I'm not super crazy about pho like my friends are, so I usually order the vermicelli with bbq pork and imperial rolls. It is very filling!
author: Ting L.

description:
I personally think Loi's pho beats the crap out of Kevin's and is better than PPQ as well. Their Bun Cha Ha Noi had the most complete selection of herbs i've had with Vietnamese food north of San Jose. It did come out a little cold (weird) but was still pretty good. In retrospect it's somewhat of a large order so i'd split it with someone with some cha gio to make up the difference.

It can be quite a wait so get in early. Also bring cash and be ready to sit at a table with strangers. But how better to make friends?
author: Misha T.

description:
The food here is good, let me just get that out of the way first. The food is well portioned its bigger than PPQ and its cheaper than Kevins(both are rival pho places on Irving that I know of) . Their egg rolls are also very very good. 

I can't find the tip section on the yelp page, so here is my tip. DO NOT HAVE TO USE THE RESTROOM HERE. I felt like I was Frank Gore when I was making my way to the restroom. Literally gotta go through the cramped kitchen with fire and food flying everywhere. When I got there I felt so fortunate to be alive that it felt as good as scoring a touchdown. 
 
The place is dirty though, there are flies roaming around everywhere, nobody here speaks English and they tried to overcharge us on the bill at the end. If you get the check its mainly just squiggly lines on top of squiggly lines; its impossible to verify what you ordered from the check. You might have to take out your phone and start calculating everything to make sure everything is in order. We corrected it without any complications though, which was good. The service here is noticeably bad though, but it comes with the territory of an Asian owned family restaurant. The mantra of it being "you order, you eat, you pay, you leave." 

But still, overall you come for the food and that should be it. Its a pho place you shouldn't really be expecting a great ambiance or for them to cater to your every whim kind of service. if you don't like the service then don't tip well.
author: Wells Y.

description:
Like others have said this place is Cheap, Tasty, and slightly Dirty. 

***the occasional THUMB soup is served***** - The only true negative since this place is classified as a "hole in the wall" .

Bottom Line: Tasty Hangover Cure.   "Don't need to look good to eat good"
author: Cliff j.

description:
This is a dirty hole-in-the-wall with marginally friendly staff that I frequent whenever I can.  Husband HATES this place, so I don't go as often as I'd like.

Why do I like this dirty little restaurant?

1.  I am miserly.  This place is unbelievably inexpensive.  If you're as cheap as I am, 2 can eat here with a tip for 10 dollars.  You cant even do that at McDonalds....
Pls note- I have a touchy stomach, and have never in the 10 years or so I've been going to Loi's been sick from anything I ate here.

2.  Food tastes good.


Why my husband REALLY hates this place?  He used the bathroom once.  I told him NO! DONT DO IT!!! but he was desperate.  Huge mistake.  I am not exactly sure what happened, but he was scarred for life by that bathroom.  Now he wont go back.
author: El B.

description: Cheap cheap cheap! But in terms of what you get, it's not worth your money! There was a giant dead fly in my pho, DEFINITE NONO
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Loys is always crowded. for the past 5 years i have been coming here and it's always the same.  DELICIOUS PHO! it has a different flavor than most , a but more fish sauce in the soup.
When you come during the day, hope your not shy, because if you a seat, you may be sharing a table with another couple.
pretty cool to be in such a small tight place.
-good prices
-a large selection of  Vietnamese food
-clean, well lets say as if your afraid of heights, don't look down.
Hea! you can't beat Loys, its a staple for the Sunset district!
I guess i just like these little hole in the walls, with good ol' character and good honest food.
I have not been back in two years, and the waiter remembered us. 
what a trip.

like pho? gotta go and try their style of noodle soup!
author: Matt J.

description:
Best Vietnamese in the city.  

Bullets:
-$5 Pho
-$1.75 Beers
-Sooooo tasty!
-Run by a sweater-vested, friendly man and his daughters.
-Locals only

Love Loi's.
author: Andy T.

description: The price is very good for the food there. Likeee theres only medium and large size for the pho . Medium is a about only likee 4 or 5 dollars. Its really worth it here. The pho is soooooo good! U MUST TRY  NUMBER 1 LOIS SPECIAL PHO OR SOMETHIBG LIKE THAT LOL. I forgot the name. I just remember the the number is 1 on the menu haha. ITS REALLY GOOD . I MEAN REALLY GOOD. And the price is really worth it too! Considering a small restaurant this plce is really good.(:
author: N S.

description: Ditto Jason L's review.  I've been dreaming of the beef stew noodle soup!  and I finally satisfied this craving.  I was asked if I wanted the "tomato" or "curry" based soup.  I took the curry.  It's not really curry.   They give you the basil, lime, chili, and the beansprouts.  This restaurant is so special that you can even have boiled beansprouts.  Now that is special!  This place reminds me of going into someone's home and the parent's are serving really special soup, flavorful, and lots of meat, noodles, and carrots.  It is so cheap and hearty that I always come away with being way "too full".  I also get greedy and order the Large. I love love this place.  Yes, the tea is not being filled, but I'm just so busy eating.  The place is small so when it is packed, it seems smaller.  The best time to come is at 5 p.m. Cash only but plenty of banks on Irving St.  They have a TV but in Vietnamese.
author: Helen L.

description:
When I think good Vietnamese food, I come to Loi's.  This has been my go to place for YEARS.  Its a family owned hole in the wall type of establishment but they serve delicious food at awesome prices.

What you "should" come here for you, is the rice plates.  They serve Pho and Vermicelli but the rice plates are whats the bomb about this place.  Oh and their Eggrolls are awesome too.

It might not be the cleanest place to gotto but I have never had ANY issue with this place and the staff is always nice and helpful.

Lastly I would like to add, if you are allergic to peanuts, they put peanuts on their rice plates, so make sure to tell them to take it off or order a Pho dish instead to be safe.
author: Kelley A.

description: I used to come here all the time with my friends since they love this place. The food is pretty tasty but I always end up with a tummy ache after. There was also a time when there was a dead fly ROLLED into the spring roll. Pretty darn disgusting. I've rather save my stomach by going to another Viet place. I don't know if they replaced their chopsticks or not, but last time, I saw some that were molding.
author: Cheryl P.

description:
My impression of Loi's:

- Among the biggest fresh shrimp + pork rolls I've seen. Comes with two dipping sauces - a peanut and a fish sauce. Both were a bit oily for me. One order includes two rolls. (see photo)

- Fish Ball Pho - delicious. I like how you have the option to order in different sizes. The medium was just what I wanted. Comes with fixings - a small platter of fresh bean sprouts, lime, jalapeno and basil. Noodles were nice and chewy with a comforting clear meat-based broth.

- Ambiance - wood slat tables (reminds me of a lodge), a bit dingy for that 'hole-in-the-wall' vibe, and a small plasma TV screen to boot.

Good place for a bowl of Pho.
author: Cathy K.

description:
I don't like that the owner dips his hands in my soup. I like even less that he doesn't wash his hands and is an ass about it. 
The place is filthy. I can put up with a lot for a cheap, good bowl of pho. 3rd world sanitation is where I draw the line.
author: L N.

description:
Came here because there  was a review I had seen that had mentioned goat. Well, that sounded interesting and had to come. 

When I finally made it here, the place was as described, not the cleanest place around and the people who work here kind of rude. So I looked for my specialty meat and couldn't find it. 

I ordered #1, there special pho that everyone was talking about. When it arrived it was a really big bowl. When I ate it I tasted something funny but thought it was seasoning of the soup until I tasted someone's else bowl. The ground beef that they had put in the pho was bad.
author: M C.

description:
Loi's. Why didn't I meet you sooner???
You're cheap, delicious, and cheap. 
At least I now know you for the rest of my life. 

It's definitely a hole in the wall. It's super small and pretty cramped. I've seen different groups sit at the same table. That's how it is. But if you don't mind that stuff, or care about service, and you really just need to satisfy that pho crave or just want some good pho, I definitely recommend Loi's.
author: Judith L.

description:
This place doesn't look like much on the outside. The inside is tiny. Looks a typical Asian restaurant aside from the wooden picnic-looking tables. If you go during peak hours, prepare for a short wait. When you're seated and ready to order, you can't help but notice how old the menus are. It's a little scary at first and not too appetizing to think how many hands have touched the menu. But it's all worth it when you check out the prices - who knows how long these menus have been around. Most dishes are under 5 bucks!

Did I mention that the food was delicious? The beef stew is one of the best I have had. The meat is tender and the broth is so flavorful. I have had most of the items on the menu and they're all really good! This is my go-to pho place!
author: Donna W.

description:
4 stars for the pho, 1 star for everything else. 

The pho they sell is very tasty and beats any other place in the inner/outer sunset. This however comes at a price. 

Customer service is not very good. If you've been here before, chances are your order was taken by a grumpy gentleman who says about 3 words while taking your order. Also be sure to speak loudly and order quickly as he will probably yell at you for being too soft-spoken and slow.

The last comment i'd like to make about this place is the cleanliness which deserves negative stars. I don't know if its the guy's thumb swimming in my soup as he brings it to my table, or the recycling of the sprouts I used for my pho to be served to the next guest, but I really don't know why I keep coming back to this place. I guess the pho is that good. But really though, I had siriracha on the bean sprouts and the guy just picked it up from my table and gave it to the next new customer...

Bottom line is if you'd like to get good pho and don't care about sharing germs with the servers finger nails or your fellow patrons, this is the place to go!
author: Norver T.

description: The food is decent, especially for the price but I'm not sure how the health department allows this place to stay open. If the front of the house is this dirty, I can't even begin to imagine what the kitchen and freezer look like. Dirty, greasy menus is one thing but dried food particles stuck on chopsticks is another level. Service as others have stated is poor and unapologetic. Never understood why Asian restaurants are always so rude. A smile and being polite cost nothing but the returns can be huge.
author: wendy w.

description:
I love love love this restaurant!!! I've been coming here since i was about 13 or 14? The Pho here is truly authentic, i just can't get enough no matter how many times i come here. On top of that its super cheap, you might be shocked. 

Even though it may not be the cleanest place you go to but hey its definitely worth the try, you will get blown away by the flavor of the broth and just the value of the pho before you know it, super satisfying. 

I LOVE.
author: Allie S.

description: Excellent spicy crab noodles.  The place is a hole-in-the wall joint with dirty ass tables, but the food is cheap and very good.  I recommend take out for those concerned with cleanliness. Old man owner is a grumpy guy and funny to watch.  Haha!
author: Tap T.

description:
If you're looking for a down home place that will transport you back to the motherland, this is it.  Except as any traveler knows, be weary of any restaurants while traveling  because you don't want to contract something that will keep you hugging the porcelain god for the remainder of your trip.  This restaurant made me rue the very idea that a $3.95 bowl of pho could possibly be delicious. 

Yes, I was swindled and lured in by the price, the generous number of patrons in the tiny space, and the cold weather outside.  It is a tiny restaurant and pretty grimy, even by typical hole in the wall asian restaurant standards.  I chose the pho with rare beef as did most of my family.  Considering the environment, I figured this was a safe bet.  My uncle had asked the owner what was the best dish on the menu and she said "everything" which made me feel better.

It was by far one of the worst bowls of pho I have had.  The beef wasn't bad, but there were other parts of cow floating around in my bowl that I didn't appreciate.  Not just things like tripe but just big pieces of fat that i didn't even bother tossing into my mom's bowl because I was kind of convinced they should be consumed.  The broth had a weird flavor, not smoky, not salty, just sort of rich and...dirty.  My uncle said that when they boil the soup bones they are supposed to skim the scum off the top and they just didn't do that very well.  It added a strange flavor.  I couldn't choke down much of the noodles because they were just sort of bland and definitely not fresh.

The consensus of the family was that it was a never again kind of place.  They thought the flavor of the broth was very off and it was just too oily and the flavors weren't typical Vietnamese but with a little bit of Chinese influence.

Let's just say that even though my bowl was only $3.95, I ate down about an inch of it.  I just couldn't do it.  I tried.  I really tried.  And I definitely won't be trying again.
author: Mylinh M.

description: I decided to check this place out for lunch after reading the reviews. I only had the pho #1 and I think it was mediocre, Ive had better pho. Service was ok, I thought the old man was yelling at me, but its just how he talks.
author: Jay H.

description:
Have been coming here ever since I can remember.
 I always get the #4 (meatball noodle soup) and it's less than $5!
It does get crowded but things do move along.
Every time I order the BBQ pork vermicelli, I get burnt outsides of the meat which I dislike. Other than that, it's a good hole in the wall.
author: Teresa C.

description: The food, generally, is good, but the cleanliness of the restaurant sure is iffy! I usually get it to go so that I'm not really thinking about it, but while I'm in there picking the food up, I'm questioning myself if it's safe! Oh well, haven't been sick yet! Portions used to be bigger, but still generous & pretty inexpensive! If you're on a budget, go & try it. Just don't look around too carefully!
author: susan w.

description:
Cheap, affordable pho.

I ordered #8: the Cambodian Seafood Noodle Soup (fake crab meat, shrimp, fish balls, and calamari) and it was only $4 for a medium sized bowl. What a deal. It filled me up, and the soup base was similar to how my daddy makes it at home.  There was way too much noodles though.I couldn't finish it all.

There has been accusations that the restaurant is doing something to the food since the prices are so dirt cheap... but I personally think pho, in general, is overpriced anyway. Pho tastes the same in all restaurants; it is usually the soup base that differs in taste. Am I right OR am I right?

After all is said and done, this is a good place to get pho for a really reasonable price. But keep in mind that it is a hole in the wall, meaning it isn't the cleanest or the most sanitary restaurant out there.
author: Annie S.

description:
You want a cheap dinner? Come to Loi's where 4 dollars can get you a heaping bowl of pho but mediocre pho at that.

My uncles all run pho restaurants in Westminster (Little Saigon) in SoCal, so I am very, very picky when it comes to my pho. Loi's obviously didn't make the cut.

My recommendations: skip the pho, go for the bun cha ha noi and cha gio for an appetizer. Cash only. There's a B of A atm down the street next to Sheng Kee Bakery if you need it.
author: Patricia Q.

description:
I never thought about writing a review of this place. I don't know why. I've been eating here since I first moved into the city, like, 20 years ago. I know, it's dirty and it has been dirty from day one. I know they use MSG. We're thirsty an hour afterward. I know their service... what service? Actually, we're sharing a table with this couple who came in when we're in the middle of our bowls. The waiter gave them hot tea then totally ignored them and just read his news paper. No matter how they try to get his attention he was just sit there reading his papers. The couple got pissed and walked.

But wait, their pho are pretty good. The girlfriend got the Bun Rieu this time and it's top notch. Of course the bill is under $10 for 2 happy warm stomachs.
author: Rio T.

description: Where can you find a place that serve such a good pho and bun rieu for LESS than $5 for a medium? Cause Loi's is definitely the place. Not only is it affordable, it's taste so good! This place is definitely a hole-in-the wall joint! It has that feel to it right when you walk it! I'm sure fans don't mind that because people are willing to sit next to strangers just to have a pho-tastic meal!
author: Lianne D.

description:
Food is very good ,but the service was horrible!

While eating there I found some pieces of hair in my bowl. Wasn't very happy with after that.The cups,forks,and the spoon are very dirty with left over food on them.Do they wash them!?!?Lots of yelling in the store.I have heard some rumors that have said that they used their pho soup over again ... 0_0 a little creepy and disgusting.The food was good though!
author: Michelle L.

description:
i love this place when it comes to vietnamese food. one of the very few places i've found in sf that serves hu tieu nam vang kho. n________________n

honestly, this is a super duper small place and it easily gets crowded due to a long wait. but loi's is the real deal, so be aggressive when grabbing a table. 

i honestly don't care about atmosphere or whatever type of hipster shit people complain about. i'm paying to eat my food.
author: Victoria N.

description:
I do not understand the high review in Yelp. I am a big fan of pho noodle soup. I have been to many pho noodle soup restaurants and they are always good. But this one was soooo bad and I would never come back again.

The price is cheap, so are the food and service. The old man was rude. The place was dirty. The beef tasted like wood.
author: Kimkaphon C.

description:
Filthiest Vietnamese place! 

My friends all were seated. I had to GO THROUGH the kitchken to use the bathroom. I was really shocked and DISGUSTED with the kitchken. Floor was covered with food, the countertops are filthy, raw chicken was sitting in a bowl, and the grill makes me want to scream. The bathroom door is covered in FILTHY grease. I saw a meat in a bucket outside next to the bathroom door. It is unorganized, and FILTHY. I am really shocked that this place is sill open and rated 86 by the health inspection. The health score has to be tampered with because I think this place should be rated 50 and shut down. I told all of my friends that I am leaving and refuse to eat here. We all left. Everyone should avoid this place or get some food posioning!
author: Spike S.

description: Worst experience ever because we found hairs in our pho. If u want to get a sick stomach u can come to this place. The man in the shop was also very rude, dont expect they will serve u well.
author: Simon L.

description: I've been here many times with my friends and have enjoyed the food. But this one star review is for my most recent visit. I ordered a medium size #1 . The door was open and many flies were in the restaurant. What I hoped not to see in my soup is what it was. There was a fly in my pho. Omg lol. I lost my appetite when I saw that. I told the guy and he gave me a new one. But I barely ate it cause I lost my appetite. Also when we paid our bill we paid with a couple pennies and they said to me and my friends "We don't accept pennies" . Wow , really ? Money is money. But then he still accepted the money. Lol. Long story short , I plan on never going here again.
author: L R.

description:
This place is SO cheap!

$4 for a medium (which is the smallest size) bowl of pho! Honestly, I wasn't amazed by the broth or the meat, but it was a warm, filling meal for less than $5! Also, they were open on Lunar New Year when most other pho places were closed for the day so that was also a plus.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
This joint has the best chicken pho soup in the Outer Sunset.
However, my wife and daughter dislike the buzzing flies and unkempt interior.  
My daughter calls Loi's, the "Chicken Fly Soup Place."
So, I cruise in solo every so often, slurp and read.
author: Edward A.

description: F*ck this dirty restaurant and especially the a**hole owner. I don't set the bar very high when it comes to customer service in Asian restaurants, but this restaurant is the absolute worst I've ever been to. I ordered the Bo Kho beef stew, one of my favorite dishes in Vietnamese restaurants. The first thing I noticed was the broth, it didn't have that rich brown color like it normally does..it was murky yellowish and tasted awful. I then inspected the pieces of meat, but all for one or two very small cubes of beef the rest of the meat was all nasty fat. Not the glutinous fatty meat, I love that, no this was really just a big clump of fat that hardly looked edible. I laid my chopsticks on top the bowl and waited for someone to come by. The owner finally comes over and I politely and quietly (I did not want to interrupt the dining experience for the other people there) explained that I did not enjoy the stew and that it mainly consisted of big pieces of fat. He instantly started yelling at me and said that I ordered it, so I had to pay for it. I only had a few bites and told him that I was not going to pay for it, because it wasn't made well. He said that is the way it's made as though I've never ordered it before. I stood up and made my way towards the door and he blocked my way and started throwing his hands out at me and started swearing at me and ordering me to pay. At that point the whole restaurant and pedestrians outside were staring after all the commotion he started over a lousy $5 bowl of stew. Worst dining experience I have ever had. Don't be tempted by the cheap prices here: go to Pho Tan Hoa when downtown in Little Saigon or even Pho Huynh Hiep 2 right up the street. This owner has the temper of a Viet Cong warrior on a roid rage!
author: Dan S.

description:
First time there, and most likely my last. I was there with some friends solely because of how cheap it is. It is $1-2 cheaper than other Phô places but the food is also cheap in quality. Broth is overly salty and the Bûn that I had (Vermicelli noodles), came out cold (like out of the refrigerator cold) which made my BBQ beef cold even before I started eating. Place got full after we sat down so no surprise about possible dinner rushes, but the old man who works there yelled at two girls for taking too long paying their bill. It was super awkward as the whole restaurant stopped with their meal to see what was happening. 

Overall cheap prices shouldn't result in cheap quality, at least not that far down. I left 1/4 of my food as it wasn't worth it anymore to eat. 

Not returning, at least not voluntarily.
author: Andrew B.

description:
This review is for dine-in service. I would give 4 stars for the quality of food. 
This place is cheap, literally. I like their pho, but not so much the rice plates. I ordered the five spice chicken and it tasted nothing like five spice chicken, just roasted chicken. I like the food here but this place is so dirty makes me think twice about eating here again. They use plastic kitchenware, the tables, chairs and floors are not clean at all (if you can't feel the stickiness of the tables you can already see it). Since the plastic cups in which they use to serve tea were so dirty (you can see some oil floating around the tea) I asked for some ice waters but the waiter said "it's 50 cents each if you want it" and that's what I meant when I said they were literally cheap! and not very good customer service too; you get what you pay for.
author: Carmen L.

description: Food is decent. Bad atmosphere. Unhappy attitudes. Very unsanitary. The old guy who does checks touches money and then touches the side vegie plates for soup right after. Doesn't even washes his hands.
author: Marvin G.

description:
Never eating at this rat hole ever again.
 If I could, I wouldn't give it any stars. I never write reviews unless I'm bored or the place really pisses me off. Horrible customer service to start things off. From the beginning, the place looked unsanitary and sketchy but my mom, brother and I decided to stay. The second thing I noticed was the lady making the food wasn't wearing a hairnet, even then I was "ok, whatever." 
I ordered #22 shrimp and pork over rice noodle and I thought it was pretty bomb at first. Mid-way through the meal I found a short strand of black hair. Ugh. Mind you I have waist length hair that is several different colors (dark brown, light brown, blonde, and red- been too lazy to re-dye it) if it was my hair, it wouldn't look like the pubic hair that was in my food. I quietly tell that old arrogant waiter and he takes my food away. He comes back and slams the check on the table and says "15 dollar" then walks away. 
So at that point I'm already disgusted so I pay the fucking $15 and start to walk away. Then he comes back and says "No. 15.60" so I give him another dollar and kindly say "She should really wear a hairnet" This asshole has the audacity to call ME cheap and yell at me in some kind of Asian language (I'm not being racist-I'm Asian too!)  I don't  make a scene but I told him (& everyone in the restaurant) that I found a hair in my food and I still paid for the other 2 meals I got. . 

I should've went back to get my .40 back if I'm that cheap. 
Better pho places elsewhaere
author: Gabby A.

description:
What can I say? This place is CHEAP and serves great pho! I came here so many times and had been turned away because they ran out of soup...(a sign that this place is good!)

Honestly, don't get anything else on the menu but the PHO! The spring rolls were okay but the pho was amazing for the price! The one negative is that  this place is a total hole in the wall, so it's definitely not the cleanest (which is why I didn't give it 4 stars). The service is standard mom and pop -- so barely any service at all.
author: Janelle P.

description: Try #25 Bun Ha Noi. You get a plate of lettuce, basil, bean sprout, cilantro and cucumber along with rice noodle and a bowl  of BBQ pork with the broth sauce.
author: Thimathy P.

description:
This is the poster child of "hole in the wall."  Everything here is dirt cheap and so very tasty!

Unfortunately, dirt cheap may be dirty as well (like they should really get new menus, tables, utensils), and tasty is salt/MSG heaven.  I usually drink about a gallon of water afterwards, but I'm too high from MSG to care.  I'll continue to visit this establishment as long as I don't get sick.  Been going here for a few years and I've yet gotten sick from it, so it is good in my books.  The place is small with about a 25 seating capacity.  So come early if you want to avoid the rush.

I keep this place at twice a month quota: the salt and MSG at this place can't be too healthy for you.
author: Jason L.

description:
I came here because it's always busy when I pass by.

I see why. SUPER CHEAP pho. Medium is like 3.75, large is 4.75. It was pretty good too. They give you a lot of meat and their rare beef isn't what you typically get from other pho houses, its better slices of meat, might be flank steak? 

BUN RIEU IS NOT ON THE MENU, its posted on the wall! I came here after seeing pictures of it on yelp and I wanted it. I didnt see it so i didn't order it. The second time I came here. I ordered something else because I didin't see it but my friend pointed it out because we sat closer in!. Gah! 

I really like number 25 too. their north vietnamese grill pork? I love the meatball they give you. YUM! 

Anyways, I docked a star for dirty surroundings (wet floor, sticky tables, tight space) 

My bf and I had lunch here and the bill was 11 something! didnt get drinks but drinks are only 1-2$
author: Erica L.

description:
Loi's is the epitome of an Asian hole-in-wall restaurant. 

The pho here is sooo good!!! Full of flavor and good portion size, all for $4.

WARNING: This is a typical Asian restaurant, customer service does not exist.

Just sit down, and know what you want by the time the owner comes to take your order. Food comes out pretty quickly, they'll get you water/tea whenever they're free, but forget about refills on a busy night.

I usually order the Bun Rieu, or #3 Beef noodle soup (they are NOT skimpy with the beef!)

Overall: I'd recommend and bring my friends here, but pre-warn them about the service and size of this restaurant.
author: Pearl L.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE!! They don't even deserve a star.

Service is ridiculously horrible!! 

Found hair in my food and they refused to take it back! (PICTURE UPLOADED! SEE FOR YOURSELF!!) Then they tried to charge for it! Hell no I ain't paying for that shit!! Had to call the cops on the owner for assaulting my friend after he refused to serve us! WTF? POOR SERVICE DOES NOT GIVE YOU THE RIGHT TO PUT YOUR HANDS ON NO ONE!!

Next time Public Health will be called to shut your ass down.

Well, there you go Loi, got a fair warning from PD.
author: Jenn S.

description:
My favorite pho place in San Francisco. My family and I come here at least once in two weeks and the owner knows what we order. My favorites are the bun rieu and hu tieu (seafood noodle soup) and the price cannot be beat.

Don't come in here expecting great service and cleanliness because this place is sure a hole in the wall sort of place that is more of a quick eat. 

Definitely my favorite comfort food in cold SF weather!
author: Laura L.

description:
I was craving some Vietnamese food and
came here for pho, which came out super
fast! And I ordered soy bean milk, which most
likely came out of a can, and didn't even reach
the top of my cup. The food was good, the inside
is pretty small and don't try using their restrooms-
unless you're about to pee your pants. It was pretty
scary going past the kitchen and very slippery.

My total was $5.45.
author: Karen D.

description:
My girlfriends chicken pho had a hair right on top of the bowl. We called the owner to come take a look but he asked, "What?" as if he did not see anything wrong with her bowl of pho. We pointed to the hair and he took the bowl back to the kitchen then 5 minutes later he brought out the exact same bowl of pho except without the piece of hair at which point my girlfriend lost her appetite. 

We gently confronted him about whether they cooked a new bowl of pho and he got upset. After we paid he stood in the middle of the restaurant and yelled, "don't come back" over and over.

Dirty restaurants with verbally abusive owners do not deserve 4 stars--no matter how cheap it is.
author: C t.

description:
Well, food is super cheap, I mean super uber duper cheap ! And the quality is pretty decent for the price they charge.
And the owner was really nice to me, even when we stayed a little late cuz we didnt know they close at 9pm. So they deserve 4 stars! No regret!
author: Alan T.

description:
The only reason I come here is for the bun rieu on their special menu. The price is cheap and food is good (4 star), but service is really bad. 

First I'll talk about the bun rieu. It is addicting. The bowl of shrimp and crab paste vermicelli soup with tomato is delicious. I normally don't eat very much, but I can probably eat a large bowl of this. Will return for food but NOT the service.

The service is just bad. I came here with a friend and bf, and my friend asked for 3 cups of water in Cantonese (the owner speakers Cantonese). He basically ignored my friend. 10 minutes after he brought back one glass of water and said "whoever wants it can have this" in Cantonese. And returned to the cash register and complained loudly in Cantonese that each of us at the table should ask for water if we really want it. I mean... Who does that? We are customers.... My bf later asked for hot tea and he ignored us again. O well, not surprised.

Ps. Last time I came here with my bf and asked for extra basil and bean sprout, they did not want to give it to us. Ugh... Just frustrating. If it wasn't for the food I would never return to this place. You never know what they're saying behind your back.....
author: Whitney W.

description:
Almost permanently stuck onto the extremely sticky table...that wouldve been a nightmare. Speaking of nightmare, I felt like I was in one while eating there. The place is ridiculously dirty and unsanitary. Saw one of the workers making the pickled jalapeno condiment using jalapenos that had fallen to the ground. 

I guess, if anything, it will help boost your immune system assuming you don't keel over and die beforehand.
author: Orie O.

description: Although the food is quite tasty, I don't like eating off of dirty dishes with food particles left over from the prior patron. I immediately asked the women who served me for a new clean plate, instead she handed me a napkin from off the table. I should have walked out then, but my food was already served and I couldn't resist the taste of the delicious, tomato broth crab paste, egg drop soup. Shame on me! On the way out, I went to pay, that's when I noticed dirty dishes stacked sky high. The dishes were being  hand washed. I won't be back again.
author: Aveda H.

description:
The food is great but has a lot of msg. Price is unbelievably cheap.

The old guy that works there is really rude. He did NOT apologize after he spilled hot, boiling soup on my mom's arm.  It was the other two ladies who were apologizing to us over and over again, and wiping the table for us. Afterwards, as we were leaving, he still did not say a word to us. I used to love this place soooo much, but I'm never going back anymore, period.
author: Diana T.

description:
OK so I get the insanely cheap pho prices- $3.75 [medium]. However, with hair, a nail (?), dark bloody meat in bloody-smelling soup, and a reply from the owner that it's supposed to be "like that", I think not. 

A friend brought me here once prior and I thought wow not so bad- pre made pho with meat that was a bit tough, grimy yes, hole in the wall, fine, and cheap, fair deal. So I wanted to bring others here too as a test of consistency.

Perhaps I came on an off day, but still... I really wanted to love this place since the other reviews were so ravenous.  Yet, courtesy to each customer is important if you want to keep their business and I don't believe our experience rendered that true. Guess I just can't appreciate the restaurants' full "ambiance".

-disappointed pho-lover in sf
author: Jennifer Y.

description: I LOVE my pho, don't get me wrong. All pho places are at least decent to me, but not this place! My friends and I ordered soup and the way the server holds the bowls are not appropriate at all.. HE SERVED THE BOWL RIGHT IN FRONT OF US WITH HIS THUMB IN THE SOUP!
author: Stephen B.

description:
Something's changed.  I feel like their flavor of the soup is more bland now.  Maybe because this place is getting more popular, so they're adding water to their soup??
I'm not sure.  

The price is really cheap.  You can get a bowl of pho for less than $4 (cheapest I'v ever had).  Yea, price is great, but the restaurant itself is quite dirty and normally, I don't mind trying out a hole in the wall, but I usually refuse to touch anything else in there.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Never mind the service here or the interior decor. It's crap! Not to mention, this place is dirty as hell! Don't use their bathroom, it means you will have to walk by the kitchen. Trust, you don't want to see the kitchen. 

So why do I keep coming back? This place makes the best bun rieu I've ever had! Maybe it's that thumb in the soup- every single time they serve me the bun rieu, they always have their thumb in my soup. Adds flavor? 
Maybe I keep coming back because they serve the cheapest pho I'll ever find in the city. $4 for medium, $5 for large and $6 for Xlarge. 

Well, if you do decide to give this hole in a wall a try, (and I strongly recommend you do) let me give you some tips to prevent yourself from catching food poisoning: 

1. DON'T drink their tea. You use that hot liquid to wash your chopsticks and utensils. Bring your own water.
2. Don't touch anything! The table, the chair and etc. If you must,  then don't eat with your hands!
3. Have them boil the bean sprouts before serving it to your table. 
4.Scoop out the top layer of soup before pigging out your Pho. 
5. Don't lick or suck on the chopsticks/utensil. 
6. Don't drink/eat to the bottom of the bowl. 
7. Flush your system with plenty of water after eating. 



Cash only cause cash is King.
author: Jenny K.

description: First of all, the pho was great. If you know what you want in the beginning and do not need to ask/change your order. I do not think you go there for any services, I did not even received my water re-filled (even I asked couple times). When I want to change my order meaning instead of putting the meat inside the bowl, I asked him to change it to beef on the side. Man, what an attitude I got. "Which order?", I said both. He ignored me. So, I repeated myself a few times even the lady inside the kitchen heard me. I was like WTF? Then he said you have to tell me which one. I was like... are you deaf? but I did not want to say a thing, since I don't want my food added with something special in there. Anyway, Food was great like I said. Price is incredibly cheaper than other Pho place I have been to. So, I guess nothing is prefect.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Date/Time:  Saturday - 8:30pm
Occasion: Catch-up dinner with a girlfriend
Party of: Two
Location:  Ridiculously small. Definition of hole-in-the-wall! Not very clean looking.
Ordered:  Pho dac biet size medium
Total incl gratuity: ~$10 TOTAL, yes...for two people!

Seriously the most inexpensive meal I have had to date in SF!  Two people including gratuity $10. O.M.GEE!  There is certainly an extensive menu so it's not your typical pho and rice plate only kinda place.  The place is run-down looking - from the exterior to the interior, to tables and menu.

That night I was craving  noodle soup so of course I went with just a bowl of pho.  Kinda wish I had tried something else.  Their pho was only OK.  Great portion but wanted the broth to taste more authentic. It was lacking a spice, just can't put my finger on which one.  Of course the service is what you'd expect - minimal and lacking...but they do their job of getting your order and bringing the food to your table in a timely manner.  I'm really curious to try some of their other dishes, now reading after the fact, the great reviews.

Maybe some other time...
author: Jess C.

description: Hella cheap and deelish street style Viet food.  Cash is king. Dude there speaks Viet, Mandarin, Cantonese and English and maybe a bit of Espanol. If the food is great then please just don't go to the kitchen or bathroom there LoL. Bathroom is a hop, skip, limbo, tip toe, and a squeeze right past the kitchen. Enjoy!
author: Troy V.

description:
I have second thoughts about writing a review for Loi's. It already gets pretty crowded and there's really not a lot of space to work with inside. So maybe I should stay quiet and let people rumble on about poor service (if i ask for something, they get it for me - they even refill my cup of tea before it's empty), sticky tables (it's from the polyurethane lacquer on the tables - they probably could have used something that wasn't as glossy but the stickiness is NOT from food residue), health scores (in my humble opinion, these ratings are seriously overrated. anyone who has traveled to any other part of the world has undoubtedly encountered something worse than a restaurant that fails inspection). 

But this is one of the few honest to goodness Vietnamese places and I feel the world should know that.

Whenever they run out of broth, it's because they've sold what they made for the day. This means they don't water down like other places. To me, that's assuring quality.

They keep their prices low (5.95 for XL, 1.75 for Vietnamese coffee). They work their butts off, just like the rest of us so the prices are low. To me, that's honesty.

There's no place that has better BBQ pork - juicy, perfectly seared, and deliciously juicy. To me, that's special. 

I've never been disappointed when I leave because it's pure goodness.
author: E L.

description:
Great hole in the wall place. Cheap food but it's really good.They have typical Vietnamese food, Pho, Pho Thit Nuong (BBQ Meats Noodle Soup), Pho Ga (Chicken Noodle Soup), Bun (Rice Noodles), rice plates, and egg rolls/spring rolls. Prices are are definitely affordable for the people on a budget but want some good food for their money.

I got #28, Com Bi Thit Nuong, BBQ Pork over rice with pork skin and meat and added egg rolls to it. The plate was $5.75 without the addition of the egg rolls, around $6 with egg rolls. Our orders came out pretty quick and it smelled so good. HUGE plate of food for what you pay for. Lots of rice and meat and one egg roll. The meat itself was delicious. Not dry at all but not full of fat.

Definitely a new spot for me to come get my fix on Vietnamese rice plates!
author: Juliane N.

description:
