Food is super tasty and cheap! My favorite is grilled pork over rice....yum. All their other food is pretty tasty as well. Noodle soups are really good too. The owner there which is the husband and wife is super nice and sweet. Totally support lil mom and pop shops!
 
Highly Recommend!
author: Sharon T.

description: My feelings go back and forth about this spot. The food is cheap. The food is good, normally, but sometimes it ain't. I love the owners, but sometimes their service sucks. Used to be my favorite vietnamese joint in the city with Tu Lan, but now I prefer Kevin's.
author: Bobby R.

description:
The short little rude Vietnamese guy that runs this place is a liar and a cheat. I gave him $11.46 for my takeout that was $6.46. I waited for my change but he turned away and went on his way. When I asked for my change, he looked at his cash register and insisted I gave him the exact amount and shooed me away. He even had the nerve to say to me "why didn't you tell me you gave me $11.46?" I was like don't you look at the bills people give you? He said NO!! Seriously?! If I gave him $10 and said it was $20, I doubt he'd be giving me change for a $20. That's such bs!! I tried reasoning with him but he then starts yelling at me saying I had issues and I was the one lying and made a big scene in front of the whole restaurant. 

If you eat here, check your change and be prepared to be treated poorly and a bad case of diarrhea!! It's a filthy rat hole.
author: lily l.

description:
***UPDATED 7/9/07***

I am sad to say that I am now fervently against returning to Loi's. Their prices are still cheap but for my being a loyal patron for 5+ years and my boyfriend being a common face there for 10+ years, this place has really gone down the chute. 

It started with a normal ordering experience except the owner was a bit rude. Fine, busy day, understandable. Brought out some ice water, my drink of choice. It tasted like? Cleaning liquid. It was like the cups hadn't been washed properly and there was still a film of cleaning liquid that came off in the drinking water. I thought maybe it was just my cup, but no, my boyfriend's was exactly the same. So we put those aside and began eating our dishes, which were norm.

Then we asked for 2 to go boxes. He then proceeds to tell us that he has to charge 50 CENTS for EACH box!!!! We mention, we've been here for over 10 years and we've never been charged before. His response? No "sorry for the inconvenience," no "oh I'll waive it this time but keep it in mind for the future," just a cold and VERY rude "it's expensive for me." I know people in the restaurant business and I know to go boxes are an added expense but it's not THAT expensive that you have to charge 50 CENTS for each box. 

So all in all, I think that Loi has just decided that instead of raising his menu prices and driving people away (I wouldn't have minded a 5 cent increase to stay up with the times rather than charging for a flimsy, plastic box), he has decided to charge each person per box. 

With that type of attitude, the now mediocre food, the poisonous water, and the lack of courtesy to say the least, I would not recommend ANYONE go here. There is another tasty vietnamese restaurant right down the street a couple stores in from 19th, right on Irving as well. Let's try supporting restaurants that actually care about their customers. And to think, I put in a great review for its food just last year.

*******
Recommended Dish: #3 (Beef Stew) & Fried Egg Rolls. This small, cozy restaurant is one of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've been to, impressive considering how many I've visited (at least 20) in California. You may have to wait on weekends and on cold winter nights, but turnover is fast and the wait is worth it. Service is friendly, prices are inexpensive, flavor is phenomenal. This is a must try if you are looking for hearty Vietnamese cuisine.
author: Ellen C.

description:
OMG, this place is SO GOOD. it's the best pho place in town. seriously. i usually go to turtle tower or ppq or golden star in chinatown for pho, but this place beats them all. SO DELISH! and for the price?? you can't beat it. $4 for a good sized pho?? unbelievable. I've walked by this place so many times before cuz it looks like such a hole in the wall, but it's totally a hidden gem. Um, please don't come here when i want a seat.

The broth tastes like it's been brewing for ages, is full of flavor, and i think they put dried or fried shallots in it, which really helps intensify the flavors. The noodles are perfectly al dente, even the slices of meat taste especially good, i don't know why!! i would give them 5+ stars for the taste and price of their food. 

but yeah, the service and decor are less than desired. I feel intimidated, and i speak the language! i seriously look at the non-asians in here and think, wow, they're brave. i dunno, the dude might be a nice person at heart, but he does speak in a harsh tone of voice. reminds me of the soup nazi. and you just have to get up and pay at the register. don't bother waiting for the check cuz it may never come before sunset.
author: Verna L.

description:
Cheap and tasty pho!

I'm pretty picky about my pho. The meat has to be tender and soft, the broth has to be aromatic and sweet, and most of all, it has to be piping hot!

Loi's is pretty good for what it is. It's a dinky little store but the Chinese owner is pretty nice. $3.95 for a small bowl of Chin Nam...you really cant beat that. 

I would definitely go back next time im up in sf.
author: Ngan T.

description: Cheap eats, hole in a wall, family business. Good pho and really cheap. However, the only thing that is lacking is customer service. I've been coming here for years. Will definitely come back again
author: Zippi B.

description:
I'm coming back from my hiatus on writing reviews just to write one about Loi's.  My sister too me to this hole in the wall from some much needed soup on a cold night but we needed to do it on a budget.  So I tagged along as a third wheel to her and her boyfriend to get a nice bowl of soup after a rigorous Zumba workout to Loi's.

And I was in for a treat.  Yes, it's a hole and the wall. And the menus can use a little bit of reprinting - but it's the not elegant ambiance you look for at a place like this. It's the YUMMINESS of the food that you look for.

So I ordered a bowl of chicken soup with egg noodles as did my sister.  After adding the Sriracha hot sauce, I took my first sip of the broth and it was like fireworks exploded in my mouth.  The chicken broth was the best I've tasted at any Vietnamese Pho place!!!  And the price?!?! The large was a mere $5.00.  OMFG!!! Winner, winner, chicken dinner!

I think we've found our new favorite Vietnamese Pho place.  As I write this review, my mouth is already watering for the soup.  Mmmm... mmmm good!
author: Anne M.

description: Super cheap and large portions for just a small pho.  Most of it is noodle, but they give you a decent amount of meat.  So refreshing not to have a pho place rip you off!
author: Lily N.

description:
Loi's is hands down one of the best pho spots in the city. Although the atmosphere is, well, not the best, the food definitely makes up for it! I usually get the bbq beef pho noodle. Huge plate of meat with an even bigger bowl of pho for only $5.75! Can't beat it! The fried eggrolls are also DELISH!

The service is so-so. They have always been friendly to me, but I have seen them act quite salty to other customers. Whatever, its good and cheap, so who cares???

DO NOT use their restroom. Just don't.

*i recently took away two stars because of a terrible experience involving multiple hairs and a nasty, raunchy smell. I don't want to bash on this place too much, because it was once my baby child, but I won't go back again. :(

*new edit- i just couldn't stay away. hairs in my soup or not, i love loi.
author: Aviana B.

description:
Loi's is the epitome of your local hangout. It's one of the dirtiest restaurants I've ever been to, but it's also one of the most satisfying and tasty Vietnamese restaurants in SF, even better than many places in the TL district. The pho is freakin delish, huge sizes for tiny prices. The rice combo plates (BBQ pork+BBQ chicken) are hella good. I definitely recommend both of those.

Highly recommend this place if you don't mind eating in a dirty environment

Pros:
- REALLY REALLY CHEAP
- DELICIOUS FOOD!
- HUGE SIZES

Cons:
- Dirty
- Bad Service
author: Kevin L.

description: I would give the food a four star but every time it's seems I come here they rush you to eat and go.And now then they don't serve ice water to boot come on man what restaurant have you ever been to that does not offer or serve you ice water???
author: Akoni L.

description:
Inexpensive, delicious, and quick... I have been to Loi's many times times to grab a quick bowl of Pho. I even brought a friend there one day who said it was the best Pho she'd ever tasted.
There are drawbacks tho. It's tiny, so going during peak weekend hours is not recommended and there's not much by way of service. You order, you get your food, you eat, you pay, don't expect anyone stopping by to see if you need anything. i'm in there enough that the staff recognizes me and knows what i always order but i still don't ever expect small talk...
author: Dalyn B.

description:
Insanely Cheap Pho Prices--

$3.95 (M)
$4.95 (L)
$5.75 (XL)

?!?!  WHAT? $4 PHO?

Vitasoy for 65 CENTS. WHAT? 65 CENTS?! WHAT? A RESTAURANT THAT SELLS VITASOY?

Thought process for ordering my food:
1. I like rare beef pho, 
2. I am sick; I need chicken pho. 

WHAT? A RESTAURANT THAT HAS RARE BEEF AND CHICKEN COMBO? 

So I ordered a Pho Tai and Ga. I had better rare beef before; the beef quality was just not as good as the other pho places. BUT the chicken was great. I usually don't like ordering chicken pho because I think the chicken is too bland (after getting soaked in broth), but this chicken was incredibly flavorful and I enjoyed every bite. 

YES.

Yes, the restaurant is small. If your party is over 10, I wouldn't come here. 
Yes, the restaurant isn't the cleanest. It isn't dirty either. 
Yes, the restaurant is cheap. It's spitting-pho cheap. 
Yes, the restaurant is tasty. Taayyy-steee.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
It's too bad that I've only felt the need to review this place after a bad experience.  Been going for years and always enjoyed the cheap, yummy food despite the atmosphere, service and relative cleanliness.  Which leads me to the main reason for writing this...

My fam and I went for dinner last night and got either the pho or noodle dishes, along with both the cold and fried spring rolls.  Long story short, all four of us are now reeling from the food poisoning we experienced last night and early this morning, and are quite sad and disappointed that this has happened.  We wonder if other patrons from yesterday are experiencing the same thing.  Food is good and cheap and all, but going through this is not worth another visit.
author: Jaclyn L.

description:
Tasty Cheap Eats Here!!

I love the local hole in the wall restaurants where you can get good eats without breaking the bank. My friend introduced us to this restaurant a couple of years ago and I love to stop by when I'm in the Sunset Area. It's located on the bustling strip of Irving Street where there are multiple restaurants, markets, bubble tea cafes, and other Asian shops. The service is quick and the food is yummy! You can't go wrong with their bun rieu or maybe their pho ga or even their rice plates. Leave very satisfied for under $10 and that might also include an appetizer or drink too. 

And, for the perfect after meal treat...stop by Teaway which is in the neighborhood too :)
author: Lisa M.

description: I love this place because their beef pho is so tasty. They also make good imperial rolls. The bbq pork rice plate is not bad but the rice might be too mushy and soggy for some people. Im giving 5 star solely for the beef pho and the price. Don't expect service. Another thing hygiene might look questionable (eventhough they have a score of 87 on the wall haha ). Weighing down everything, taste wise I think Loi's might be the best beef pho in SF.
author: Lucky S.

description:
Favorite place for Pho but i always order the Bbq Chicken and Beef RIce plate. Loi the owner is super nice and he always hooks up my BF and i with free egg rolls. :) 

GOOD CHEAP EATS FOR THE SOUL!
author: Carol Y.

description:
You get what you pay for. The food is not that great, and the owner is so rude I am NEVER coming back again. I ordered a rice noodle soup today, and the rice noodles were over cooked and had broken into small pieces before the soup was even brought to me. I asked the owner to come over, but he did not even bother to come to our table, so I told him about the noodles, at a distance, with him busy counting money. Unbelievably, he YELLED AT ME and said "rice noodles are like that", as if I had never had rice noodles before.

If you do not want to get yelled at like I did, spend a dollar or two more and go to one of the more decent Vietnamese restaurants nearby.
author: Anthony L.

description: i love love love loi's (: i've been coming here for the past 4 years and i think no where else in SF has better pho. So authentic and the broth tastes great - not too sweet, or too sour, not too heavy, not too light! The noodles are excellent and perfectly cooked, the steak rare, and the portion very generous. i always get a #1 and im satisfied every single time. whats even better? its totally cheap. $4 for a Medium, $5 Large, & $6 X-Large. amazinggggggg right?! although it is a bit dirty, and the tables are sticky but its definitely one of those hole in the wall places that are just, hella good. I can guarantee that you will love this place!
author: Anh T.

description: This is the very first I've been to that serves you pho with pork broth.  Maybe that's why their pho was very cheap. All in all, i know what a good bowl of pho is and their pho is errrr not that good.  If ur looking for cheap eats, try it out.  There's also other things on their menu I haven't tried yet... Maybe one day..
author: Lubin T.

description:
I love the pho here. It's probably the cheapest AND the best bowl of pho you'll find in sunset. Idk why but PPQ and Kevin's taste like crap to me. I don't like the rice plates here because their fish sauce tastes funny.

The food actually deserves 4 or 5 stars. But this place is too damn dirty. The chairs and tables are sticky, there are flies attacking you when you eat. The menus look like they carry diseases. The worst part? The thumb lady. Her nails look hella nasty and she's always got dirt under them, and yes, she WILL stick her thumb into your pho. I don't want to think about it. But watch out for her!

Apparently their meat is really fresh. Thumb lady claims they have a meat slicing machine and they cut their meat on the spot. I don't really believe it. 

Their food is really good, but the dirtyness is just a really big turn off.
author: Christina X.

description:
This is the best & cheapest pho place town.   Price is low . But food is good here. I come here here almost 3 times a week . Super nice..

Love this place....
author: Erica T.

description:
This should be closer to 3.5 stars.  Don't get me wrong, I love their bun rieu!  That's the only dish I ever order from here and I've eaten here many many times.  The bun rieu is really good and has a lot of the egg and crab mixture in it.  I always finish my whole bowl and leave overly stuffed.  

So why not 4 stars?  MSG! It may be yummy while you're eating it but after, I'm dying of thirst for the next few hours.   

The service is super quick, they get you in and out in no time.  Food is really cheap, i usually end up paying $6 for my medium bowl after tips and tax. Now, that's a bargain!
author: Veronica N.

description:
Like most Vietnamese restaurant, since i am big boy, this place is tiny.
I need 2 small seats to fit me. Very friendly staff.
The Pho is the best in Sunset
On the menu: 
try the C-5
You get a vietnamese pork-chop and a vietnamese roast-chicken drumstick, with noodle soup for $7.00. A Bargain!!!
author: Matt G.

description:
i grew up eating at this place.

food is good and dirty, how i like it.

the old owner guy needs to smile a bit. he also spilled half my cup of tea on my crotch area while trying to clean the table quickly, he saw it and didn't seem to care. so i don't tip them much now.

prices are cheap, tips are low. i love this place.
author: Edwin S.

description:
I love their bun rieu. It's a good fix when you can't get the homemade stuff. Just a standard hole in the wall restaurant. Food comes out quickly, cheaply priced for SF and fills you up with a warm and fuzzy feeling. 

Their spring rolls are okay, not fabulous, but still edible. 

The staff is chinese/vietnamese and they're going to try to get you in and out as quickly as they can! They keep the restaurant pretty clean too.
author: Christine B.

description:
What is it about food that can deliver so much enjoyment? From the little exposure I have had I dare to suggest Vietnamese cuisine is up in the upper marks.

At this point I've been to this place countless times. And it is always the same "ordeal": crossing the whole SF around 11 am on the weekend just to eat the exact same dish: bunch ha. But let me vehemently assure you; I haven't gotten the least tired of it! On the contrary, if I don't have it for an extended period of time, I start experiencing unpleasant bunch ha withdrawals. Man, it is that good! 

This is a description from the internet: "Bun cha is a lunchtime only dish, ubiquitous in the north, far rarer in the south. It doesn't sound much -  BBQ minced pork in fish sauce with vegetation and cold noodles. Simple - yes. But, miss this dish and you miss out - big time."

I did have tried this dish at other places, but yet have to find a comparable one. So far it looks like my only hope would be Vietnam! That means that  Loi, the owner, is cooking some magic in that little kitchen.

 I would suggest some thorough cleaning and some updated decorations, but seriously...here I don't give a sh... Big five star for the food!!

And yeah... This place is cheap! For 20 you will have a fiesta here. And who wrote the service is rude?? No way... My bf kept bugging them to cook this special Vietnamese dish with snakes and eventually they did! And they charged him very low price, even for making something not on the menu and not having the security for him to show up. I think this dish required few hours of pre-cooking.
author: Toto B.

description:
People don't usually know about Loi's, but it's honestly one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in the city. The decor of the restaurant is poor, very poor... but if you're coming just for the food, you've found the spot.

Price? Yeah, this is the cheapest joint you can find, and taste.. the best as well. If you can get past the cracks, holes in the wall, old chairs and table... than this is your place. 

If you're aren't up for pho, I recommend the five spice chicken, it's AMAZING. However, be warned.. it takes FOREVER to make. If everyone on your table is eating pho, stick with pho... or else while their paying for their food, you'll just be starting your meal.
author: Austin N.

description:
Since my first visit, I never stopped coming to Loi's.

A medium bowl of pho only costs $3.95!

My favorite items at this place are the pho, bun rieu, and bun cha hanoi.  they make bun rieu the best here!!  the bun cha is so good too.  it tastes exactly like it does in Hanoi.

Anyway, I definitely recommend Loi's if you want a quick and cheap meal for lunch or dinner.  It's well worth your money and the food is great.  But I gotta admit, it is pretty damn dirty and gross.  So, if you're one of them then this place is definitely not for you.  Don't say I didn't  warn you!
author: Lauren Y.

description:
I DARE you to find a cheaper lunch spot that does not start with Mc and end with Donalds.

$4.75 for the tastiest pho that exists on the planet? 

No I don't want to touch their filthy menus, cuz they are dirty as shiz. But I think it's all about the ambience. Do you think they want to be this dirty?

 Well, buddy, you are wrong. When I sit on their sticky seats, and I am forced to clean my soup spoon and chopsticks with my soapy hot tea, I know i'm getting a taste of Vietnam.
author: Garrett W.

description:
Me and my friends came here on a random Thursday. I have never heard of this Vietnamese restaurant before, especially since I've lived in SF all my life so why not give it a try. WRONG !!! This place is very small and dirty, sure, we got to take a seat once we walked and the lady was nice enough to wipe down the table since it was a bit dirty, but she left the dirty towel right in front of my friend for a good 5 minutes. We tried waving down a waiter/waitress to remove it but they pretty much neglected us.

      I wasn't that hungry but I took a couple sips of the crab noodle soup and I think it's kind of bland. The spring rolls my other friend had came with peanut sauce (w/peanuts, shredded carrots, and sriracha) and fish sauce (w/ sriracha) . First of all, I am also a waitress at a Vietnamese restaurant so I am very familiar with Vietnamese food. There is not supposed to be shredded carrots in the peanut sauce or sriracha added in either sauces. I usually just add the sriracha myself. Unfortunately for my friend, she hates spicy food so she asked for peanut sauce and fish sauce without sriracha and the male waiter said this in front of us, "You should have asked when you were ordering!" Then he continued to bitch about it in Vietnamese thinking we don't understand, we understood. Also I asked for a cup of iced water for my friend and then he started making a fuss about that too, in chinese, which also we understood. Obviously, the people who work here does not know how to treat customers because it is very stupid to btch out loud, even in another language (I suggest you not to talk crap in any Asian language if there are a bunch of Asians around) It was a big disappointment. I will never ever go back, and I will recommend ALL my friends to never go to Loi's ever again. I knew pho that cheap can never be that good. I rather spend that extra $3 or $4 somewhere else.
author: Didi L.

description:
Great food for the price. Try the porkchop rice plate. The pho (noodle soup) is pretty tasty as well. I've tried the two other places on Irving (PPQ and Kevins Noodle House), and would have to say that Loi's pho just has a slightly better taste to it.

The eggrolls are good too. Extra crispy and extra fresh.
author: Andrew W.

description: Love the food! But honestly the service is horrible!! The owner (old man).. Is super rude. but for cheap good pho! i will come back hahaha.
author: Anna Y.

description:
This place was awesome until they forgot about our entire table's orders, like literally forgot. We had 5 people at our table and ordered way ahead of everyone else, yet the other people who came in after got their orders before us. HMM.. our fault for not asking earlier but how can you possibly forget the largest table in your entire restaurant? Plus it's just pho, it takes like minutes to make. She was busy chatting up a storm with other customers. It took the lady like 45 minutes to realize our order was not served when she came to our table with the check and was like 'oh, not come yet? so sorry'.... Maybe it was a bad day and all, but still unacceptable.

Other than that, good pho, cheap price, 3 stars. Probably will be back again and hopefully won't be forgotten!!
author: Allyson L.

description:
I have to say, this place is pretty grubbin.  I just picked up the BBQ pork over rice with an eggroll (it was $6.25 out the door) and it was a lot of good tasty food.  the pork didn't have any fat on it whatsoever and the bbq sauce was nice yet not overpowering.

Place wasn't as dirty as I had been expecting (from reviews here), and it had a very 'cozy' feel.

Will def. be going back with these prices and quality!  I LOVE LIVING IN THE SUNSET!!
author: Alex L.

description:
I ate at Loi's for the first time on Saturday. I had tried many other PHO restaurants along Irving St that were also quite good and now I have found that Loi's has the best food, price and service. I wish I had tried them earlier anyway they won me over now :)

Keep up the good hard work Loi's!
author: Clark P.

description: The pho here is so cheap compared to other places on Irving. A bowl of pho costs around $4-5 & it tastes pretty good. The shop is too small though & inside it's very dirty looking & cramped. I would recommend getting takeout from here to avoid the lines and cramped space.
author: Kristy L.

description: I would rate this 0 stars if I could. Although the pho is really cheap, their broth is not good nor rich in flavor. It's a very small, hole in the wall restaurant and I believe it's family owned. Customer service here is by far the WORST I have ever experienced!!!!! They are so rude in every way possible! I don't ever get greeted when I walk into the restaurant, and when they take my order, they don't say a word! They come to the table and just give me the dirtiest look! DO NOT COME HERE. Pay a couple extra dollars and go to another pho restaurant because this is not worth it.
author: Jacky N.

description: Love this mom and pop type of restaurant. Small little place with the best price and delicious Pho.
author: Jeff H.

description:
2.75 quality food + 0.5 stars for being super cheap
Dirt Cheap Pho!

Hole in the wall joint that sits about 40 people. They dont mind sharing their 6 person tables with 2 parties of 2 (European style) so just be aware of that. They specialize in noodle soups in which most mediums are $3.75, larges are $4.75 and extra large being $5.75 if available. 

#1 Lois Special Beef Pho
Had northern style ground like beef with the normal thin pho noodles with tripe, meatballs, brisket, and cartilage. The broth was somewhat flavorful although I have tasted more rich soup before. The bean sprouts were kinda old but the mint was fresh and plentiful. The broth was not as hot as most places but better than luke warm. For the price they give a lot of meat though

This place is not the cleanest establishment but if you are craving pho or just noodle soup dont mind the underwhelming decor and are short on cash come here.

PS Irving parking $2/hr is quite the pain
author: Robert Y.

description:
Just ate here for the first time with a couple of friends who recommended that we eat here because the food was so good. (not the case)

The pho was okay but, I didn't appreciate the fact that I had a ladybug floating in my bowl....(yeah I still ate it). I figured...I'd rather eat the one that I found the ladybug in before I started eating, instead of getting a new one and not seeing the ladybug or other crap that might be in the new bowl...

The service is pretty bad as well. The waiter almost left our table without taking my order...after he took both of my friend's orders. When we asked for water, they only brought out one cup...we had 3 people at the table...another fail. 

Overall, this place is very small, a little on the dirty side, and the service is horrible to say the least...the food would have been more enjoyable without the ladybug too.
author: Cary K.

description:
So torn. Worst service I've experienced in exchange for the most tasty and inexpensive ($3.75) beef noodle stew in the city. 

During my most recent visit  we asked for two ice waters and homeboy Loi(?) did not acknowledge our request (walks right past like we don't exist). He surprisingly shows up with water but brings us only one tiny little cup. Snarled when we explicitly asked for the second one. Upon payment, gave us wrong change and then cussed at us ("sh*t cheap" mixed in with janky Chinese) when we asked for the correct amount.

Zero stars for service, four stars for food and price.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
It feels like a Little Vietnam.  That's why my wife wanted to leave after sitting down for 10 seconds at the last table on the left side.  It was the very first time that she and I wanted to venture out to this tiny crowded spot for some pho. I have to admit I was little bit nervous by the not so clean tables with pieces of jalapeño sitting next to my elbow, but seeing how crowded this place was, is quite assuring that this place, at least their food, can't be so bad.  I was right. I am still glad I didn't listen to my wife and left the place. I guess women ain't always right about everything (although gents you should always listen to your wife, except when your want to dine at Lois).  
We were lucky as we got the last two seats at the corner. Looking at the menu I could not believe my eyes. $ 4.75 for a large beef noodle soup!? What the pho??? So we ordered it and BBQ pork over rice with egg rolls. Everything was so delicious. Especially their broth. By far the best on Irving. I used to go to Kevin's all the time because I liked their broth better than PPQs, but Kevin's doesn't come close to Lois.  Did I even get to the famous bun lieu yet? If you like the taste of crab, well, a stronger taste of crab, then you will surely enjoy their bun lieu. I swear they put crack in it because it is addicting! Bun lieu is crab mixed with egg white and maybe shrimp over tomato broth and vermicelli. I can't believe this deliciousness is like $ 5.75 for a large if I remember correctly. 

Yes, the owner aka service may not be great. But I like him. He's extremely efficient in his service as he'll minimize the amount of words with everyone. It's understandable because they are always so busy. I really, really appreciate how low the prices and delicious their food is. For people making close to minimum wage in SF, we can really use a place like Lois.
author: Mike S.

description:
Their prices is amazingly cheap!!! I believe it's about three bucks for a medium. (They don't offer a small size, which I find strange). The pho is rich in flavour and the noodles are absolutely not soggy.

Cons: Rude service, they expect you to speak Chinese. Bean sprouts aren't fresh.
author: Jenn D.

description: 4 dollars for pho...I haven't seen prices like these since I was a kid and it's been awhile. I was hesitant because I grew up with a pho place on every other corner. I wanted to give this place a try since it was so cheap and there was no harm. I warn you now, this place is a definitely a hole in the wall. I would wipe down my chopsticks and spoon before using them. The pho broth was different...but in a good way. It was full of flavor but there is something about their broth that sets them apart from all the other pho places. The portion size is quite filling and I think you will be full with the medium one.
author: Eve C.

description: So first couple of times I have been here, I had good experiences. I liked getting pho here, and I had no problem with it. But then this past Friday, when it was a super busy night, I decided to go with a BBQ Pork Pho. A friend recommended it and it's a plate of the bbq pork with a big  bowl of pho on the side. I tried it, and I was not very pleased with the taste of the pork. I had to dip it in the sweet fish sauce, that they provide with their really oily and old tasting imperial roll. It helped, but I don't like the idea of doing that. And then half way into the meal, I felt sick. I went into the bathroom, and puked. At first, I thought maybe it's just me, and my taste buds are not use to this style of pork? I can deal with that. Or perhaps maybe the pork was off that night?  But then after me and a friend finished our meal, I step outside, and right in front of the freaking place are two piles of rice noodle vomit. And then no joke, I walk around the corner to where my car is parked, and there is another pile of rice noodle vomit. Soooo maybe it wasn't just the pork that night, but other dishes as well. It sucks, because I did have good experiences here prior to this past Friday. But consistency is really important. Three piles of vomit on the street and don't forget to include my vomit in the bathroom happening all in one night is just way too much. So long Loi's. I am definitely not coming back.
author: April D.

description:
Loi's has become an inside joke amongst my friends who are not from San Francisco.  I had never been before my girlfriend took me, but Loi's was synonymous with ultra cheap, ultra dirty food.  My girlfriend put it best: "that the owner has no qualms about scratching his head before putting the food before you".  Damn...snow flakes in your food...most wadDUUUUP.  Being in the mood for pho, she decided to take me here.  Walking in, this place is a damn hovel.  Taking a menu, I had to hide a laugh.  This menu was so old, yellow'd, and curling b/c of age.  It was like an ancient treasure map.  However, this place is not unlike many Vietnamese/Chinese places.  The service is very brisk and they don't waste time conversing.  They have mastered cleaning tables with a 1 squirt, 1 wipe technique down to a science.  Minimal quirt of cleaner + minimal effort on a wipe = profit.  I ordered the noodle dish with beef and pork skin while KJeh ordered the pho.  10 seconds later, I KID YOU NOT, 10 UCKEN SECONDS LATER, the food arrived.  My noodle dish is very simple...lettuce, beef, peanuts with a bed of noodles resting on top with a side of nuoc nam.  Mixing it all together, I was not that impressed.  The noodles were a likttle tough and dry.  They sprinkled in about 5-6 peanuts.  The beef was good however, and the pork skin didn't add much flavor.  My girlfriend is a fan of Loi's pho but when I tasted it, the noodles were not to my liking.  I did't try the meat and the broth was belly warming, a testament to the MSG laden preparation I am sure.  

Loi's is comfort foot, similar in vein to King of Thai.  It is a quick meal.  In addition, the price was only $10 bucks.  What the hell can you get for $10 these days.  You cannot rate Loi's as a restaurant, as it isn't.  It is what it is - a hole in the wall.  You don't come here for any customer service.  You come here when you are too lazy to change or brush your teeth.  3 stars for Loi's.  Just beware of the snowflake special.
author: Brian V.

description:
Not my favorite Pho place in the Sunset.  There are way more better ones out there.  I tried this place twice and both times, I wasn't impressed.  Their Bun Rieu (Shrimp paste noodle soup) dish is really sour because they used too much tomato paste and not enough of the shrimp paste.    They have this dried noodle dish that is less than $4, which they give you a bowl of clear broth along with it.  That's really cheap.

Their tables are like picnic tables you find in parks.  They ought to get those changed soon.  They're disgusting.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Thanks to Yelp... this one is a keeper... 
Another one of those lazy Sunday afternoon, we haven't had our lunch and it is almost dinner time.  Not feeling to cook at all, so off I searched at Yelp for some good and reasonable Vietnamese food and I found Loi's.  The place is quite small and cramp.  The person that was sitting behind me keeps hitting my back whenever the person moves because it was pretty narrow.  Anyways, the service was ok.  The food was actually good considering how very reasonable the price is.  The pho is probably one of the best I've tried.  We also like the shrimp roll appetizer.  Overall, we like and I will definitely come back.
author: Surfer S.

description:
Ouch, I've must've came on a bad day. Seeing the reviews here, the majority seems to love the place.

My close friend/gym partner were headed to the gym. He wouldn't shut up about how great pho' would be. Sure enough as our stomach's started grumbling we turned the vehicle cruising towards downtown back to the sunset/richmond.

Our first choice was closed today, so he told me that Loi's on Irving would be a good hit. I've been an avid pho lover most of my life. It's almost impossible to disappoint me when it comes to pho'.

We walked into Loi's, the place was very tiny. I was expecting this, no problem. The service on the other hand wasn't too good, I asked where the restroom was, I was told to wait. Then I had to ask for Ice water 4 times. Asked for the check like 3x, ended up just walking up to pay.

That's ok, I'm used to this at pho' places. What really shocked me was I started smelling an aroma that reminded me of how my dog smells after I take him running in the rain at the park. 

Sure enough it was the bowl of Pho Ga being placed infront of me. The soup was bland/stinky don't know how the too match. If it stinks at least let it taste like the heavens. The noodles were super salty, I don't even know how that works. I didn't even eat the pieces of chicken in it.

My friend though, enjoyed his beef Pho'. I on the other hand will steer clear of this place in the future.
author: Tip S.

description:
Loi's is legit.

Keep in mind, though. This place is really dirty, but it won't kill you. They're supposed to post that green inspection card rating somewhere for customers to see but they don't. The owner pretty much has no manners. Some people may not like it, but hey, I am a very patient guy so I get a free show every time I come here! I call it "What's This Dude Gonna Do Next?"
author: Forest S.

description:
If you're looking for pho in San Francisco, this is the place to be. Unlike the other restaurants on Irving, this one serves all the cuts of beef in the beef noodle pho. Cheap presentation but good taste and lots of it. Same goes with the other dishes. Also, fast service.

Not good for groups with more than eight people.
author: Brandon Y.

description:
I live right around the corner from this pho place, but even if i didn't I'd still give this place 4 stars simply for the value. Super cheap pho (about $1 cheaper than any place around) and the flavor is a lot different than your typical pho restaurant.  Still not anywhere comparable to the legit home made pho that I'm used to, but this place does the job well enough.

The rice dishes are all cheap as well, not the best, but a good value. 

Sure this place is a little sticky and grimmy, but once you get past that you'll find both your wallet and stomach quite satisfied.
author: Ngoc N.

description:
a hole in the wall, seriously. I think i can punch holes in the walls bigger than this. 

a good little place for vietnamese food. it has this bit of home cooking flavor that gets lost in the bigger vietnamese restaurants in the city. pricing is avg compared to the other vietnamese places. Just another place to consider when you're looking for vietnamese food. Don't overlook this place when your usual places are packed.
author: Michael L.

description: I'm a fan of the food. In fact, this is my favorite pho place but I am not a fan of him (owner). He is rude and refuses to take blame or apologize for his mistakes but since I do love the price and the food, I have to continue coming here.
author: M W.

description: I ordered Pho (3 Meats Soup) from the menu and instead got a bowl of soup with meat and what looked like rice vermicelli noodles. Really? $5 for a large bowl doesn't look like much to complain about and it shouldn't have if it was an actual bowl of pho. A large bowl of pho is usually good enough to fill up me for a good part of the day. I walked out of here half full/half hungry.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Great value & tasty. Dont expect superb cleanliness or anything, youre paying 6$ for an entree. Friendly people with difficult hearing.
author: Anh N.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing. I found it because I just moved to the sunset and woke up craving some pho. I went to my iPhone and yelped for the nearest pho place. Loi's ended up being the closest to me. I found this place 2 weeks ago and I've already been there twice.

The portions are super big for the price you pay! So, it's totally worth it! So you may ask why I'm giving it 4 starts instead of 5? Well it's pretty clear that Loi's food is amazing, but let me explain the cons of this restaurant.

The actual place itself is pretty small, so it's very likely that you'll have to wait. The first time I went there I only waited a few minutes, but this last time I had to wait about 10-15 minutes. I noticed that a few people left after probably being too hungry to wait, so I can see Loi's losing a lot of business from the size of their restaurant. Now, the second reason why I'm giving this place a 4 instead of a 5 is because of the SERVICE! There are only two people trying to handle the entire restaurant. Looks like they're an older couple. The wife is very nice, but the HUSBAND is absolutely horrible. He is rude, harsh and has no sense of customer service. Sir, I understand your restaurant has amazing food at amazing prices, but please try to take a few seconds to treat them with respect.

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place! Other than my two cons, the food is just so amazing compared to the price you're paying!
author: Shari H.

description:
Wait, what?  200+ positive reviews? You're only getting 2 stars from me because the pho was so damn cheap, otherwise we'd be looking at just 1.

This place is disappointing because:
1. the pho broth is gross
2. was my beef sitting out for a while?
3. it's so goddamn crowded!
4. can I change the channel...PLEASE??
5. I had to ask for ice water THREE TIMES. wtf.

Perhaps I should have ordered something else.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Sun was actually shining in the sunset when we first arrived to this tiny little spot. Waiters were friendly, food was great and for the amount we paid, it was definitely worth driving down here for it. One large bowl of pho with tons of noodles and meat, one small bowl of pho, one bbq pork over rice with egg rolls and one bbq chicken plate for only $30!!

**Cups need to be washed before serving water!!!
author: Anonymous P.

description: Good flavored pho; divey atmosphere; great prices
author: Benny A.

description:
Things to eat here: EVERYTHING

This is hands down the best Pho restaurant in town but beware it this restaurant is a hole in the wall and is not as clean as u would like it to be.

Pho prices are ridiculously cheap

$3.95 (M)
$4.95 (L)
$5.75 (XL)

They make their Pho very homestyle and not loaded with MSG like the other places......been comming here for years now and never fail to impress.!!!!
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
If one were to stick Loi's bbq chicken on a bed of shredded cabbage and put along side it two scoops of rice and one scoop of macaroni salad...
....and this plate were to be served in any plate lunch spot in the 808....
....this place would SELL OUT aka 86 this chicken plate every single damn day....
....and the owners would be rich.
Just a thought I happen to have every single time I eat in this beat-up, hole-in-the-wall Viet spot.
If you're from the 808, you'll understand.  
Their bbq anything is still the KABOOM!
Their fresh shrimp rolls are the best I've had in The City.
Ultra-wallet friendly!
No can go wrong!
author: Barry A.

description: Yes the service is bad, but you get what you pay for. C'mon, you can't beat a bowl of pho for only $4! The man who always serves us is rude and grumpy all the time. I recommend asking the lady to help you, she's always really nice. I'm pretty sure that all the bad service reviews came from the old man. If you dine in, I warn you to use the tea they give you to wash your utensils. The pho is reallly delicious, my all time favorite pho restaurant. This restaurany is perfect if you're looking for a cheap restaurant with $10 bucks in your wallet. You'd walk back out with at least $5
author: Debby L.

description:
Don't judge a book by its cover! The place looks pretty janky... small, sometimes smelly, old sticky wooden tables, & their utensils are not at its best shape either. BUT this place has the best freakin' pho! 

I crave their pho every single time I think of any kind of noodle soup. Their broth/soup has its own unique taste (in a good way) that seriously cannot be compared! I really like the meat too b/c it's not too dry/chewy like some other places.

Their eggrolls aren't bad either, but I know a spot down the street that has better ones.

It's the perfect remedy for cold days in SF ... and probably hangovers. 

REMEMBER THEY'RE CLOSED ON WEDNESDAYS! I learned my lesson... haha
author: Sandy M.

description: I've been to loi's since I was little! Meaning that's a good 15 years for sure. Loi's has a good selection with good value! I ALWAYS get the bbq pork over rice because it's so delicious! It also helps that I don't have to travel that far to eat at some Vietnamese food! The restaurant is great..however the downfall is that it's a pretty small place so there is usually a wait. Also the place isn't that clean, but if it passed inspection and i'm not getting sick it should be ok!=]
author: Briana H.

description: One of the better places in the area and it's amazingly cheap however it really is a hole in the wall but it's an amazingly cheap place if you want a meal for under 5 bucks. Yes. Dinner for two for less than 10. And you get a huge bowl so be sure to bring your appetite!
author: Daniel M.

description:
Two words:  Bun Rieu.
(Crab Meat and Tomato Noodle Soup)

They have this as a special on the wall in small, medium, large....so order depending on your appetite.  Every time I order a different bowl of soup, I always wish I had ordered the Bun Rieu instead.  

I've been coming here since 2006, when my co-workers at SF State introduced me to this whole-in-the-wall joint.  I've  eaten here plenty of times taking take out, dining in after a night of partying and needing quick hangover food, and getting my fix of homey vietnamese food.

A couple things to point out for the newb's who will be going for the first time:

-  The place is small (be prepared to wait if you come at a busy hour).
-  They are staffed by one server (don't be embarrassed to waive the server down to order and get your check...and don't expect them to go to you)
-  Make sure you bring cash.
-  Don't come with a group larger than 4, otherwise you'll be squished while you eat.
-  If you want to use the bathroom, prep yourself to walk through the kitchen to see 'where all the magic happens.'  (not for the clean freak)
-  If you don't think you can handle any of the above, you probably shouldn't eat here.
-  Otherwise,  enjoy your meal!

My RECOMMENDED dishes:
Bun Rieu
Northern Style Vietnamese Pork w/Rice Noodle, 
Egg Rolls (ask for extra lettuce to wrap)
Any of their Rice Noodle Combo bowls.  
Vietnamese Iced Coffee
author: Char C. B.

description:
This place has very good pho - and it's so inexpensive as well. It's a "hole-in the-wall" type of restaurant. 

The only thing I dislike how it's CASH ONLY.
author: Joy Q.

description:
It's been a while since I came here, and now I discovered here the prices are pretty cheap compared to other similar restaurants.  $4.75 for a large bowl of Vietnamese soup noodles or $5.75 for an extra large bowl. That's around $1 less than most such places.

The place is small though (and I know for a fact that they have a very tiny kitchen).  Also, the owner could learn to be a bit more friendly in his greeting.  Those are my two knocks about this restaurant.
author: H K.

description:
This tiny restaurant is pretty grimy, but I have been coming here for about 20 years, and not once have I fallen ill. The pho, vermicelli dishes, and imperial rolls are all great and super cheap. 

Definitely my favorite Vietnamese restaurant on Irving, although sometimes when I'm with my friends, we just don't feel like sitting in this dirty hovel.  On those days, we will go down the street to PPQ or Pho Huynh Hiep (Kevin's).  But on the days when I need to keep it real and eat some good, cheap Viet food, Loi's is the realest.
author: Tim W.

description:
This place is awesome! Alright, so it's not the cleanest... But just because you get a stomach ache or "throw up everything you just ate" doesn't mean they're trying to poison you. I know their place looks like crap so you'd assume they don't clean their stuff. But if you look at other restuarant kitchens elsewhere, I guarentee you'd find the "sanitation look" just about the same.

Where else can you get good pho for this price? This isn't an authentic Vietnamese place. If you're looking for one, then this isn't the place to go. It's a place for fast and cheap food. Their service isn't outstanding, but they get the job done. They give me my tea and water when I ask, they bring my food and take my order promptly, and give me the check when I'm done. You don't go to a place like this and expect 5-star service.

This is a hole-in-the-wall kind of place. If you want something fancy, then you should know by looking at it to not step inside.
author: Sara K.

description:
#2 visit. The bun rieu was watery (lacks flavor) and I made the mistake of ordering the "sauteed" beef dish with rice noodles.  

Anyways..it's cramped and always busy.  The quality is fair but it's cheap for a quick bite to eat.
author: Jboogie L.

description:
This review rating must be prefaced with the following expectations:
- All standard hole-in-the-wall thresholds apply here.
- Ambience is medium-to-low
- Service is medium-to-low
- Speed of service is high
- Food presentation is low
- Food flavor is medium
- Food quantity is high
- Restaurant cleaniness is low

You understand this threshold matrix, and you go inside. I go to get fed and warm. When the lunch, dinner and weekend rush is on, drop all above levels down 1/3. 

I won't over-analyze food in this review. I usually go for the noodle soups. BBQ pork and chicken flavors are good. Portion is just a bit less than other places, but it's appeal to me is the lack of MSG symptoms from eating here, the full flavor of food, the heat of the soups, the cool of the bun, and the speed of food at the table.

I actually came here the first time because somebody once yelped this places uses no MSG. After having pho, I had no tinglies in the shoulder, and did not break out in hives. (Yes I am an MSG detector.) After having bun, I did break out - most likely from the marinated BBQ sauce on their pork and chicken. 

This rating is -1 star because of the male owner/server, who has his own brand of customer service, which obviously does not include customer respect. Tapping his pen on the table at folks who he wants to get out is rude even at global train station eateries. Don't expect more tea other than the original cup provided. Don't ever change your order lest the fear of back-kitchen tomfoolery. Hey it's his resto, so whatev. 

If you're not too needy for the touchy-feelies, you can cheaply nourish yourself here.
author: Loocha L.

description: I had been there lots times.Nice Special beef pho and egg rools.the waitress is better than waiter at there.and they are all overseas chinese not Vietnamese and speak Vietnamese.
author: H S.

description:
This is my standard for good Vietnamese food, seriously. The place is a hole in the wall and it's literally one of the homey places I've ever ate at. For this place, it really is a compliment.

The prices are amazing. The service is usually quick and attentive, although I have to say that is probably more about getting me out of there and getting more people seats than anything else, but I'll take it! They're very friendly and willing to explain anything I have questions about what something is if I want to try something new. i usually end up getting their rice plates though. There is just sooo much meat and rice, and the meat is always marinated fantastically. 

You HAVE to at least try this place if you want some good Vietnamese food in San Francisco, seriously. The only thing that pisses me off about this place is that it closes on Wednesday. You have NO idea how many times I've come here on Wednesday excited for some good lunch or dinner only to remember that they're closed, obviously too late.
author: Rick C.

description:
When you come here to the restaurant, the tables are usually a bit sticky.  It may be the tables aren't very clean or it's just the texture of the table.  It feels sticky.  Another thing, try not to ask for cold water.  It seems the cups aren't as clean and sometimes my taste like cleaning solution.  I would ask for hot tea.  It's still in the same plastic cup, but at least I don't taste the cleaning solution.  Probably masked by the taste of tea.  

The food is delicious.  Nothing wrong with the food.  I've been coming here for quite some time.  This may be my last time and I'll explain.  The customer service is the worst.  Makes you feel uncomfortable.  They don't accept credit cards.  While I was eating, one of the customers didn't have cash, so they let them go get cash at a local ATM to pay the bill.  Of course, the customer had to leave their drivers license with them.  Which is understandable.  If they had a credit card machine, it would go a long ways for bring back repeat business.

Now here's why I won't go back to this restaurant.  On my last visit, the owner of the restaurant, who usually runs the front, had an argument with one of the cooks in the back.  I don't understand what they were arguing about because it was in a combination of spoken Vietnamese, Chinese, and English.  But it was loud and heated where the owner was in the middle of the restaurant floor while the cook was in the back.  Yelling across to all the customers to hear.  It looked like there were going to or was about to get into a fight.  

I asked for my check and a a couple of boxes to wrap my food to go because I didn't want to be there when that was happening.  When I asked for the boxes to wrap up my food, they said the boxes were 50 cents each.  I thought I didn't under tand them and said "excuse me?'  He said "50 Cents".  I said "what?".  He said "50 cents each box?"  My friend said just get it.  My thought was, do they want us to finish our food so I don't have to get a box?  Why is he telling me that a box cost 50 cents more?  Screw it.  I take the two boxes and when I got the bill, there it was.  An additional $1.00 for the two boxes to take the rest of the food home.  I couldn't believe this.  So I paid, and undertip.  Get my $1.00 back from the tip.  

BAD customer service, no respect for people eating at the restaurant, cups not throughly washed.  Food is still great.  But customer service is the worst.  May as well eat a five star dinner sitting at a dumpster watching your back for dear life and avoid people asking youf or extra change.
author: Jack L.

description:
The restaurant is pretty greasy and sticky. Kinda gross, but hey, the food is cheap and edible here. Nevertheless, the boss is kinda disrespectful. Always walks away when we didn't finish ordering. Employees would sometimes give us the wrong check or money back. Occasional yelling and creaming among the boss and employees. 

Just take it to go.
author: Thuy O.

description:
I really think the cheapness of the prices makes the food taste better. FOR FIVE BUCKS (ish) I got a bowl of pho half the size of a medium-sized watermelon. So generous. 

I got the beef pho, my friend got the "special" beef pho, where special means the meat is tangled...looking (vs. sliced) and tastes a bit more gamey. If you ask for "everything" that means you are OK with eating tripe and fat and tendons and other non-muscle meat bits.

The food came extremely fast too, considering it was packed when I was there. In summary: instant, cheap and relatively tasty gratification for pho-related cravings.
author: cecilia y.

description: LARGE Pho for less than $5?!?!? Although it didn't taste great..it still is friggin dirt cheap.
author: Liz W.

description:
Hahaha I'm the type that likes to eat comfortably, the service and environment plays a huge part in liking a place....This place definitely have good and cheap pho but it's not exactly a big comfortable place....every time I come here I want to hurry...eat and GO. It's a pretty small crowded restaurant, doesn't look very very clean....haha sticky tables.....old looking chop sticks and so forth. I mean there's a first for everything right....if this place was cleaner it would be one of my favorite place to go...

I mean for the price you pay for a bowl of pho, it is worth it, you get plenty of meat...the broth is really good but again, the place makes me very uncomfortable that's why they get 3 stars, if it was just a tad cleaner, even a new paint job, new tables and chairs can do the job.....this place would be my favorite pho restaurant....
author: Helen T.

description:
If you like pho, then you'll like Loi's.

I have been to this small vietnamese restaurant for years now. I have not been disappointed once. The food is great. I always order the old reliable number 1! Sometimes we order the egg rolls, which are always delicious. I always order an iced coffee to go along with the meal. Yummy!

As far as the service is concern, there's nothing much to complaint about. The food service is quick and the waiter is efficient. The only thing I would mention about Loi's is that it doesn't accept credit cards. So have your cash ready.

Even though we don't live in San Francisco anymore, we always go out of our way to eat at Loi's. It's just that good and the price can't be beat!
author: Philip M.

description: From SF to Orange County, no doubt, Loi's have the best Bun Rieu! Still subtracting 1 star because it's probably the dirtiest restaurant I've eaten in.
author: Tiffany U.

description: If it's possible, I wouldn't even give them a star. The worst ever, I've been here before and I don't remember them being so freaking rude. Can you believe it, first I got ignored for asking for the CHECK? Omg, the check! We are trying to pay you guys! When we do get the check. I'm trying to hand the money to them. I get snapped at saying "Geez, can you wait?!" Wtf, I'm once again trying to pay you guys!!! She later goes and tells someone saying "Can't she see I'm busy?" Like really?!?! The guy answers her "They are just paying." So what?!? You guys want us to wait when you guys don't have customers to take care of us. Screw that! No tip!!!! Never ever again!!! Will I come back this crappy, dirty ass place!!! Plus their pho soup tasted overly sweet!!! Put hella fish sauce and it didn't help. Just a little advice. If you guys don't like helping or serving people get out of customer service business. TIPS are earned for great service!!!
author: Jess Y.

description:
I'm a huge fan of this place....love the small, divey, not extremely "hole in the wall" per se, but the intimacy level of this restaurant is good.  We were directed here by a couple of friends who came upon this place by happenstance (usually the best way to discover a eatery).  

We were told that you can get a bowl of pho for under $4.  I was skeptical and excited.  Seeing the reviews for this place made my wife and me feel good about it.  

For me, I grew up eating pho.  And like many out there in Yelp, I have had great pho and mediocre pho.  And, I love morning pho!  We decided to try this place at night...We both ordered Pho Tai...and had an order of imperial rolls.  Rolls tasted just like grandma used to make...fresh, kinda of chewing, lots of carrots and meats.  The bowl of pho was tasty.  Not extremely hot broth (which I tend to enjoy), but the meat was nice and raw, the broth was flavorful, and the noodles were kind of chewing (just right).

I believe we'll be back to this place over Yummy Yummy, which is also good.  But for the price?  This is unbeatable.  

Also for those NHL fans, the owner seems to enjoy watching this on their tv screen.  Bonus!

Btw: the extra large bowl, HEAVY...

THEY ARE CLOSED ON WEDNESDAYS!

Please eat here!
author: felix c.

description:
This place is good.  I would have gave it 5 stars but  it's dirty and the service suck.  I guess it's what you can expect from a hole-in-wall Asian place.  They give you good proportion for a good price.   The place is very small so the seating is very tight.  Yeah, lots of negative.... but did I mention it's GOOD!  

I recommend buying it to go and eat at the comfort of your home.
author: junk m.

description:
This was the first pho I've had in San Francisco and boy do they make some good pho. I sometimes stop by here and eat dinner on my way home from work or out of the Sunset.

 I get the #1. They had the option of adding an egg to your bowl, which was new to me. The egg definitely gave the soup a different, but good taste. Meat was definitely juicy and red--just the way I like pho meat.

The service was super quick but some might consider it "rude". I never minded.
author: Ricky Z.

description: the food is cheap so it's great for a person that is trying to be on a budget. My friend enjoyed his meal, the 5 spice chicken and grilled shrimp, and the portion size was good for the price. I've had better spring rolls elsewhere, the peanut sauce lacked flavor. I might come back again to try the Pho, I'd have to be pretty broke tho, also please hold the flies.. i don't really enjoy them buzzing around our heads as we try to eat our meal.
author: Lily S.

description:
I wouldn't hesitate to give this little restaurant a 5 star! Not that it's fancy or extremely clean but the food quality/taste cannot be beat. We have come here frequently and impressed with the taste of Pho! It's best around SF in my opinion. The rare steak is so juicy and tender, the broth is authentic without sign of MSG.

Bun bo kho or bun thit nuong are also very good. Not to mention the price is ridiculously cheap.

I have recommended many friends/relatives to this place over the year and they are coming back from time to time. Highly recommended.
author: EasyD N.

description:
Loi's chicken pho is the best I've had. It comes out hot and packed with flavor. Glorious notes of savory, sweet, fragrant, salty come out as you devour your pho. The imperial rolls are good as well as the 5 spice chicken. But really, get the chicken pho, dress it up with some basil, lime, jalepenos (and/or whatever else you like to eat with your pho), let the flavors meld together and simmer, eat your imperial rolls in the meantime, then... it's time to dig in! What comfort! What pleasure! What warmth and happiness! 

And be forewarned - the prices are dirt cheap (I believe $4 for a small bowl of pho)! So don't expect sparkling tabletops or porcelain when you go to Loi's! Fill your tummy and you're good to go!

Medium chicken pho + imperial rolls to share (1 1/2 rolls per person) + tax + tip = $7.50 per person for a yummy lunch or dinner!
author: Christine C.

description:
In a little shack in the Sunset on Irving, there is a Vietnamese place called Loi's. At Loi's you will find the mythical $3 pho bowl that many believed was extinct after years of archeologist digs. Many from all sides of the City come to experience a "real" Viet restaurant.. and this is just that.

Good food. Ok service. Amazing price.
author: Matthew L.

description: Honestly they have the worst service ever and the owner/server is very rude, and the bathroom is inside the kitchen, makes me wonder wat was in my food
author: Dennis C.

description:
It was one of those rare hot nights a couple months ago.  The owners kept the door open.

OMG giant flying bug!  OMG it's in my face!

Me = jumps out of seat screaming and ducking
Friend = WTF?
Other Restaurant Patrons = WTF?

Later .. 
Friend = "that was hilarious"  

Ah, what a magical night.
author: Yeeman N.

description:
For the most authentic and delicious Pho without going to actual Vietnam is Loi's. 

This is the place you bring someone from out of town that wants real pho that matches those of the streets of Vietnam. 
The broth is great and the special beef that they serve is really good. It is rare beef that cooks while in the broth.

It is a really small place and not the best aesthetically . But it is authentic food. Fits no more than 20 people, even less. Get to go if you want.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Edit - 11/02/09
I have to come back to change my review on this hell hole. The service loses 3 stars. 

The guy waiter in there is rude as can be. Fool didn't sit us or anything when we walk in, so we just sat where ever. 

I said hi to him after he brand us water, and he just ignored. I know he's probably a refugee and didn't go to school, but man come on its basic human etiquette. 

So all that aside, I don't really care for. He came and took our order after we try hard to get his attention, then listen to this: He comes over and fuckin dont listen and just jot some bs down his paper and guess what? HE GAVE US THE WRONG SHIT WHENT HE ORDER CAME !

We order two number 1, one large and one x-large and a shrimp roll, but bam! He gave ONE number 1 and the eggroll.  I had to walk up to them and ask them did they make a mistake. And when they gave me the new order, it was the X LARGE ONE, not the LARGE I had ordered !


I mean dude man just piss me the fuck off. I do not know what the hell is wrong with that guy, but he need to get his head check.

We didnt even finish ordering and he just walks away. The restaurant wasnt even busy... I mean come on. God dam it I dont know why this piss me off so much. Fuck this place.
author: U L.

description:
Since it was a cold friday evening we decided that a nice hot bowl of pho would be our comfort food. We chose Loi's over our regular place, only because it was a place we haven't been to yet. It's a really small restaurant, a hole-in-the-wall, nothing fancy about this place at all. The menus, utensils, and all your sauces are all on your table. The tables are pretty close together too..only one walkway separates the tables across the rooms. Probably no more than like 12 tables there. 

We ordered the ex-lrg #1 pho ($5.95) and a northern pork noodle dish ($5.75) - the table next to us was having eating the northern pork noodle dish, and it looked pretty good. The pho was pretty good tasty, the soup wasn't bad - but I've had better. The pork dish was yummy - they give you a plate of rice noodles, lettuce, mint/basil/cilantro, and the bbq pork is in the fish sauce and you can roll up the meat in the lettuce or just eat it as is in a bowl. 

I didn't like the fact that when we got there the waitress came with cups of tea...and right when she was going to set it on our table she was distracted and started talking to the people walking through the door that she ended up spilling HOT tea on my bf's arm! It was another waiter that saw it, quickly ran over and grabbed the tea from her hand and put it on our table and apologized. This is such a hole-in-the-wall place that when I asked for our check, the waiter just told me the total! That was kinda weird. Overall, its cheap and not a bad place to get your dose of pho comfort food.
author: Betty S.

description:
This place is HELLA dirty. I would bring my own chopsticks. And bowl. And sauce dish.

However, the pho is only like $4. HELLO? $4?!?! That's DIRT cheap. Not only that, but it was pretty damn good. I don't remember which exact pho I had, but there was meat in it. Lots of it. Lots of TENDER meat, was not tough at all. Plus that they had a TV to watch the game on; it distracted me from all the flies buzzing around my bowl.

I'd only go here if you're not afraid of dirty places.
author: Munnie T.

description:
I moved to Los Angeles in March, however, prior to that I had the opportunity to spend a couple months in San Francisco.  While walking one day in the cold and rain, I stumbled across Loi's.  Upon entry into this unassuming little hole in the wall, I had no idea what to expect.  After a brief once over of the menu, I went for the bbq beef pho. What came out was at first not what I thought.  A side of grilled beef and a bowl of broth with noodles.  

But upon further exploration and a single taste, I found myself slurping up the last noodles and eating the meet as though it would be my last meal. 

Without question this is the best hidden gem in San Francisco when it comes to pho.  The kicker only thing I did not like about this restaurant was the price. My bill was $6 including a diet coke. I think they should raise their prices by at least $4 a serving that way I can make sure to have a table the next time I want a seat!!
author: Bradley G.

description:
totally one of the most underground pho joints in sf! there's no place better to get pho for this price! the XLarge pho bowl is only 5.50, and they give you way more noodles than the average Xlarge. their five spice chicken with rice is also tastyyyy! it's a cramped joint, but who cares when you saving $? 
the service can be iffy at times. my friend asked for 4 waters in vietnamese, and the lady turned around and said "I don't have time".........WHO SAYS THAT!? We end up laughing about it afterwards. Good thing their food was cheap and tasty; otherwise, we would be having a fit!
author: Jason W.

description: Cheap ..... The main reason why i am here all the time with my parents. The food quality is better then you think once you sit down to this whole in the wall. for a better consistent taste, get the rice plates. I had experiences where the pho would taste different sometimes. The beef is not your sliced beef. It is more of a chopped mashed beef. Different but alright. Give this place a try for the food and not not the Decor or how you are treated.
author: Michael T.

description:
Papa Loi and crew hook it up with delicious noods (excellent broths, b-t-dubs) and rice plates at prices most people haven't seen since the 80s.  In fact, it seems that the prices haven't changed in ages, which is great in these tough economic times.

The food itself is fantastic.  The grilled meats are tender and flavorful, the imperial rolls crisp and delicious (not as good as Tu Lan, but great nonetheless), the veggies fresh, and the portions generous.  

Every time I've been here, the service has been friendly and efficient, if a bit terse at times, which I don't mind so much seeing as how they can get busy and crowded at the drop of a hat.  What we lose in small talk and ingratiating inquiries we gain in speedy meals and good food -- a win in my book.  However, when Papa Loi comes out onto the floor, I can always expect a warm welcome and a smile and, if I ask for one, a free bowl of broth with my rice plates (at least my girl T.L.H. and I have gotten free broth...I can't say it's a guarantee for everyone).

The space isn't glamorous or modern or hip, but it's intimate and lively and usually full of a nice mix of locals, which is awesome.  I never understood people who complain about the small space or the fact that tables are sometimes shared or that it's not as pristine as other places.  Loi's is what it is -- excellent food at a steal made by good people -- and we like it that way.  The place is an local institution.  If you want new chopsticks, fancy fixtures, or wood and metal accents, go elsewhere -- and pay more for less.  If, however, you're down to rub elbows with the locals and have some of the best Vietnamese food out there for the price, go to Loi's.
author: Ricky C.

description:
this is by far the cheapest vietnamese restaurant i've been to. 

came here with my siblings and we got their bun rieu. their soup is very flavorful. the downside of this place is their customer service. its so hard to get their attention and they don't refill tea.. overall, its okay for what you pay for.
author: Valerie N.

description:
The food at Loi's is the standard I judge all other pho and vietnamese food to. I have been eating here since I was a fetus, for at least 24 years. At 27 years old, I have yet to find another restaurant that even comes close to Loi's. The prices are ridiculously cheap and the food is awesome. I've moved around and am now in San Jose, I still make the 45 minute drive just to eat here couple times a month because after living all over California, Loi's is just the best. 

OK people, Get over the rundown exterior of the place. Get over the dingy and cramped interior. Sit your ass down, pick up the old ass menus they've had since I was in kindergarten, and just place your order. All of that negativity goes out the window once you dig into whatever you order.

The PHO, I LOVE LOVE LOVE. The broth is always piping hot and is hands down the best broth I've had anywhere in California, it's just that good IMO. I'm always dumbfounded by how many other places don't serve the soup hot enough, the second you put all the peppers, bean sprouts, basil, and lime in its luke warm. Their broth ACTUALLY tastes like broth!!! Like they actually make it from scratch. Bones, vegetables, etc. Not the homogenized, overly seasoned (MSG?), fake broth all the other places use.

I always order a #9 which is a bowl of Pho w/ a side of bbq grilled beef. SOOO LEGIT! Loi's is the only place I've been to that does this and does it well. 

My GF gets a #10 which is a bowl of Pho w/ a side of bbq grilled pork. Also delish, only downside is the pork tends to be too fatty so i usally stick with the beef. Side note we both stuff ourselves for $20 less if we refrain from the double order of fried rolls mentioned below lol.

We always share an order of Fried Rolls (comes w/ 3 per order) and always end up ordering another because they are just that good. The spring rolls are good too but I can't find fried rolls like this in San Jose so I load up when I eat at Loi's.

The rice plates are great also if you don't feel like soup. All the meats are grilled. Beef, Chicken, Pork, Shrimp, etc. I usually stick with the beef or pork chop, can't go wrong there. Good portions of rice, comes with some chopped peanuts and fish sauce (love their fish sauce).

Vietnamese Coffee is great here too. Overall the food is amazing and the prices are a steal, I've never had a bad meal here. I only take select friends to this spot because its like my little hole in the wall secret. Pho is usually a matter of personal preference but everyone that I have brought to Loi's LOVES the food.

I acknowlege the complaints about the sticky tables, the flies (when its hot), the restroom is a joke, and the place is overall kinda sketchy from a cleanliness standpoint (I've never gotten sick) haha. But give it a shot I'm pretty confident you won't be disappointed. If Loi's doesn't end up being your favorite it'll still rank up near the top.
author: Jesse J.

description:
There are so many other Vietnamese restaurants to try on irving street, you can skip this one even though the prices are dirt cheap.
Me and my friend went there the other day and as soon as we looked at the menu maybe for no less than 30 seconds he yells from the cashier's table are you ready to order?
I'm thinking are you that lazy, to walk over to our table and take the order?
The food was ok nothing to brag about to your friends.
And the worse part of the experience is when other people are ready to pay he justs screams the amount to the patron and expects them to bring the money to the counter.
As he begins to clear our finished plates,he takes one bowl and empties all the leftover food into one bowl in front of us.
I can think of a few restaurants that does and I believe its not the right thing to do.
Anyways, if you want cheap just ok food with bad service come here.
Not recommending this place to my friends, I just don't want to lose my friends due to this place.
author: Corey W.

description:
Standard Chinese/Vietnamese hole-in-the wall restaurant.  If a Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant isn't dirty, then something's wrong with it.  Clean ones are highly suspect.  Don't come in expecting a great "ambiance", good service, or cleanliness and you'll be fine.  Besides, you come to these types of places for one reason, and one reason alone - the food.  Speaking of which...

Their grilled pork is awesome.  Either over rice or in their bun thit nuong, you can't go wrong.  Make sure to get an extra egg roll.  They make their own soy milk too.

Cheap, good, and consistent.  I'll be coming back for more.
author: Allen L.

description:
I've gotten over the fact that its dirty - their sanitary score has gone up.
My mother has grown to like it.
I never saw another dooche like I previously mentioned.
Their food is bomb!
And finally ... the food is DIRT CHEAP! (no pun intended)

5 stars cause my experiences here just keeps getting better and better!
author: Dorian T.

description: Cheap and good pho. Service could be better but that's just who they are, not on purpose. I go there at least once or twice biweekly, like my paycheck.
author: Irene T.

description: this place is amazing i always get the number 1 exlarge + eggrolls. my family has been eating here for years now. the price is cheaper than most pho places
author: Aaron C.

description:
poor sanity; extremely rude and impatient service; food is B- grade, only positive is the price; however, i'd rather paying little extra 2-3 bucks to have a clean pho in a nicer environment  to preventing diarrhea or food poison which will cost much more $$$$$ than the 3 bucks saved from the their food :d

too bad , i can't choose "0" star,otherwise, this establishment won't even get 1 star review from me.
author: J. G.

description: I've been here a total of two times. My first experience was ok. The server was not very friendly and the place seemed small and dirty, but the food was good and cheap. Usually, I can forget about a lot of a restaurant's negative qualities as long as I can get good food for a great price. However, on my second visit, both my girlfriend and I got very sick. It took me about 3 days to recover from the stomach problems I was experiencing. I will never go back to Loi's again.
author: Eric R.

description: Loi is the man!  I've been going to eat here since I was a little child.  The prices have remained unchanged through the years, and this hole in the wall will always have my heart.
author: Frank C.

description: I had the five spice chicken vermicelli and my friend the seafood soup with a beer. Overall the food and service were fine. Keep in mind this is a small, family run, very casual (emphasize...casual) but our experience was ok.  It'd be difficult to beat the prices here (a little less than $6 for each entree).
author: Kent W.

description: The pho here is great, I ordered small and it was super cheap but tasted great! The beers are crazy cheap too, this is my hang over spot now. Can't beat pho and cheap beer.. their bbq chicken tasted great too and so did beef. Going to try more dishes next time..
author: Try E.

description: Hahah OKAY! So I come here a lot right?... i used to love it, now I think this place sucks! Mr. waiter.. LOI? is so freaking miserable and has such bad attitude! Also I found 2 small hairs in my bowl of soup the other day. omg I stopped eating immediately, got the check and left. WTF? who knows what they do in the kitchen? probably snot rocketing boogers while making their soup!
author: A L.

description: Although i am not vietnamese, I eat alot of Pho. This place is better than any other pho place I have been too in the Sunset. It's pretty legit.
author: Frank N.

description:
Probably the single worst pho place I've been to. I think it's pretty hard to screw up pho - you actually have to try pretty hard if you're Vietnamese.
