Chinese people running a Vietnamese restaurant does not produce good pho. At most pho places, the number one is basically the combination, which has everything in it. The broth was very fatty and had the most random stuff. When I get pho, I expect to get thin slices of steak, brisket and all that other good stuff. Instead, I get ground meat. Who the heck puts ground meat into pho broth?! In addition, the noodles were clumped together and it seemed like it was just dumped into the broth last minute. I was thoroughly disappointed and didn't even finish eating it. The imperial rolls were also below average - they fell apart and did not taste that great. I think the one thing that was enjoyable was the Vietnamese drip coffee, but even that could have been stronger. 

Overall, lunch was quite lackluster and definitely not worth the wait. When my friend asked for his meat to be placed on the side, they forgot to do that (he asked twice). But then again, you usually ask for the steak to be put on the side (raw) and they didn't have that. I guess it would be too weird to give you ground meat on the side of your pho. The one positive was that the prices here are very cheap and I think that is pretty reflective of the quality of food that you receive.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
This may not seem like the fanciest place to eat and you're right, it's not. The menus are sticky and tattered. Atmosphere?? Well it's an old family run Vietnamese Restaurant, so what does one expect. BUT WHO CARES!?!?!! You can't beat the prices. 

The noodle soup is delicious and the other selections are just as tasty and it's so cheap. No more complaining about getting home late and not knowing what to eat? For $3.95-$6.75 you can't go wrong.

Get the #20... You'll have enough for lunch then next day!
author: Stephanie V.

description: If you're on some sort of tight budget, then this is the place to go. Their price is at least $1 cheaper than other Vietnamnese place. But if you wanna get a good quality of meat, then this isn't the place. I don't know if it was my bad luck, but I remember the meat I got was in little pieces, so I was thinking to myself that they must have bought discounted meat or something.
author: Lovetoeat A.

description: Excellent value. Feels like your in Vietnam. Take a chance and try the Bun or fresh Vietnamese rolls.
author: Slade N.

description:
This place is definitely my go to pho restaurant. I usually order the B.B.Q pork with noodle soup. It is soooo good! Though this place isnt the most fanciest restaurant it is definitely the best pho you would ever have! And it is worth your money!!!!
 
My friend and I brought a friend who was new to the place and he said their food really met his expectation, which was the very first time that ever happened. 
OH! and by the way.. the only bad thing, which isnt very that important, is that they might run out of soup... which is very sad. one time me and my friend decided to go eat after softball practice.. and we were in such a great mood to eat pho so we came to this place and they said we dont have any soup. We were all devestated and the worker there hella made fun of my friend.. in a jokingly way though, but anyways COME HERE AND TRY IT OUT!!! ITS DEFINITELY WORTH UR TIME!!
author: Alice C.

description:
Fe, Fi, Pho, Fun. The soup takes me longingly back to Vietnam and was an excellent comfort dish on a cool, foggy evening.

I am not a super expert on Vietnamese food but I have been to Vietnam before and I love the delicious beef broth soups with vermicelli noodles (Pho). I have tried 5 or 6 different restaurants in various West Coast cities in the past but have yet to discover anything really amazing in the past on my own (though I was taken to Vung Tao in San Jose and it is to die for, but pricey). 

At some of the other restaurants I have been the Pho is filled with really, really fatty and tough meats including tripe and the soup is left with a floating film of rendered fat which grossed me out. But at Loi's the meat in the #1 Pho (special beef) was very, very tender, lean and delicious and it the was the best Pho I have had. My friend also had the #1 Pho and also enjoyed it immensely. I liked having the Sriracha, fish and dark sauce (similar to Hunan) at the table to customize the taste to one's own liking.

The BBQ pork over rice with a spring role was also incredibly delicious as well. The cold shrimp rolls were OK, but a bit basic in flavor so I would recommend people try something else for an appetizer. 

After reading the reviews that described Loi's as "a hole in the wall" I was expecting a real dive and was pleasantly surprised to find the restaurant to be clean, maintained and not at all dumpy; I would describe the decor as simple, functional and basic. The service was also incredibly efficient and fast, though not overly chatty/friendly at 6PM with 3/4 of the tables occupied.

What really amazed me after the amount of great food was the price - 2 Phos (1 med/1 lg), 1 order BBQ pork/rice/spring roll, 1 order of shrimp rolls all for $20+tip and we finished with a ton of leftovers to save for lunch tomorrow. 

If you have never tried Pho, or have not liked it in the past give Loi's a try and you will surely find it equally enjoyable. 

I will definitely be back.
author: Mike L.

description:
OMG!  I thought this place was one of those hole in the wall restaurants that looked really unhygienic yet was very clean and good.  Hence, I wrote a great review in the past.  I've been to many hole in the wall spots where the venue is run down but the food is GREAT (taste as well as cleanliness).  Please continue to read for my horrific experience.

I ordered a to-go Pho all beef steak ONLY.  They gave me all beef with tripe and that other stuff that is not appealing to me.  Minus 1 star!  (It happens to a lot of restaurants, no biggie)  I opened up the soup container to pour onto the noodles and once I poured it all through the noodles, guess what I found?  PUBES!  Yes!  Pubes as in PUBIC HAIR!

I suppose the white noodles indirectly served as a filtering mechanism but I am not kidding, I found 4 pieces of pubes.  They were NOT regular hairs as they looked like curly fries.  Trust me, I know what pubes look like . . . I'm 30!  Minus one million points!!!

I hate to say anything negative about a restaurant but this was unbelievable.  Don't get me wrong, if I didn't see the pubes, I would have eaten the food as I love their Pho, but I will NEVER step foot in that restaurant again.  How in the world do PUBES get in the soup?!

THEY HAVE PUBES IN THEIR SOUP!  YICK!
author: Manton R.

description:
My family and I have been going to Loi's for our pho for many years and have found it to be the best and cheapest pho in the Sunset area. When dining in, the food comes fast and piled high with brisket, tripe, flanks, beef balls....everything you want in beef pho. The place itself is a hole in the wall, but that is why I really dig this place. Its pretty cutty, yet almost always packed. I don't really order much else, who really needs to? A small bowl of pho is around the the same size as a medium at other places, and is only about $4. 
Also, excellent place to eat to cure a hangover. Seriously, grab a bowl of beef pho with everything in it, drink some tea, and you're good for another round.
author: Zach L.

description: Came here with the wife once before and the other reviews are pretty spot on.  Small hole in the wall that serves cheap food.  Cleanliness definitely takes a back seat at this place.  Anyway, we try this place again on Saturday evening around 7pm, walk in, and the grumpy waiter starts yelling at us in Cantonese.  We don't speak Cantonese.  He walks to us and yells "no soup!".  Dude, are you freaking serious?  WTH???  What pho place runs out of soup at 7pm on a Saturday?  From now on we will just eat at Kevin's or PPQ on 19th and Irving when we want our pho fix.
author: H K.

description: Cheap pho and that probably explains why it is so dirty there (Especially their chopsticks..). I ordered a bbq pork with rice noodles and the pork was all burnt and fat. My noodles were broken into small pieces. I also got a lot of cucumbers hiding underneath the noodles. To sum it up, I basically ordered a bowl of cucumbers and fat pork. I'd rather spend extra $2-3 to go to another pho place on Irving.
author: Karen C.

description:
Loi's is one of the better Vietnamese restaurants in San Francisco.  Having gone to SJSU it reminds me of your typical downtown San Jose Vietnamese Restaurant.  

Loi's is not much to look at, tables and floor are sticky - it's like dinning in my grandmother's kitchen in North Beach.   So if you are a neat freak this is not your place.  Menus are worn, restaurant is noisy...Hey the food is excellent, the staff is friendly - so give Loi's a try but parking on Irving is tough.
author: Rich W.

description: Changed the recipe. Has MSG now. Makes us sick.
author: Lou F.

description:
So at the recommendation of a friend, we tried this place out.
It's Sunday night, I drank too much the night before and need to bleed the grease out of my system...Pho will do that for you!!

I'm always a little nervous going a new place. I have a youngster that will make sure he is heard above everyone, but tonight he met his match! The owner of the restaurant was sitting in the back arguing with his family about how much money to give someone as a gift. Right away, I was at ease.

The service was fast and good. We had a simple order, three big ass bowls of soup. The broth was great and the portions were healthy. I often will order extra noodles, but be warned, the extra large...is extra large!!! We also had the Vietnamese egg rolls/ Imperial Rolls and they were also good.

These are the places I love! It's small,loud and informal. If they get crowded, you will be sitting with strangers. I will be back to eat here again and again!!
author: JR H.

description:
I don't know about the other reviews but I found this place slightly repulsive. Reasons are:

1. Check the utensils. I looked at the chopsticks and spoons and most were black...
2. #1 came out and you can tell that the food was pre-made. I mean most places are but this was rather obvious. The noodles were in a clump. The rare beef was bundled together and the blood was a darkened brown-the color of old/freezer burned meat. 
3. The thing tasted okay but with the utensils and the meat, I was very hesitant on consuming too much.

#3 is a pretty minor detail but 1&2 are major concerns. I know this place is supposed to be a hole in the wall...but to me it was just a hole
author: Ryan C.

description:
beef stew with ho fun noodles.

don't mind the 2 guys bickering in chinese/viet - they always do that. they act like an old married couple.
author: Susy C.

description:
- Darn good pho and generous portions of it.
- No nonsense service; requesting pho accoutrements (not initially provided but necessary for true pho enjoyment) annoys the guy.
- Tread carefully if you need to go through the kitchen as the floor is slippery. Ice skating is an ideal skill when heading to the restroom.
author: Adam W.

description:
I always end up here at least once a weekend after surfing with my surf crew Chandler, Minh and Hans for so much needed hot tea and pho. 

Noodles are quite good and the broth rox! I typically go for the BBQ Chicken and Shrimp Pho bowl .... although it can make the broth a little greasy, it's well worth it. Its like heaven in a bowl that helps return my core temp back up to acceptable levels.
author: Morgan H.

description: Total hole in the wall. The tables are a lil sticky, the cups will make you wary of drinking the tea, the waiter is sloppily clad, the bathroom I don't even wanna find out about, but for a $4/bowl of pho, I won't complain... And it's actually not bad at all! I've also tried the bun rieu and it's pretty decent.
author: Anita W.

description:
Here is the routine: Enter and indicate how many in ur party, sit down and check the menu- i recommend the Pho Tai Lan, aka #1 house special-- usually go with the medium (3.95, any pho over 5 bucks is a rip) with an order of cha gio (egg rolls rock here!)-- right when you receive some tea pour a little in a napkin and wipe down ur chopsticks and spoon.

You will receive veggies for the pho and moments after the special delivery.  I usually load up on spiracha cause thats how i roll.  Ewww...the broth is so lovely.  This place often has a bit of a wait during lunch on the weekends (less than 10 tables), but one of the best Pho in SF that rivals spots in San Jose.
author: omar b.

description:
A San Francisco staple if there ever was one.  Discovered on my way back from high school on rainy day in the 90's, tupac blaring on the radio followed by some TLC and tracks from Dookie, Loi's quickly became one of my favorite hole in the walls.  Been going back ever since.

The pho here is delicious.  The soup is very rich and hearty- one of the best tasting pho soups I've ever had.  The beef is hand sliced and good quality.  Mr. Loi and wife are good people and keep the place lively.  My favorite?  #1- Loi's special combination.  And it's a steal at $3.95.  Recession prices!

Yea, it's not the cleanest place, but the food makes up for it.  Plus, reminds me of having Pho in the streets of Hanoi.  All the more authentic.  

4 stars!
author: Jeremy H.

description:
Honestly, the rave is endless but the food is not... 

I am very particular about the aroma of pho. THEY DIDNT have AROMA..... more like boiled WATER! 

I am very upset that my first experience at Loi's was not what its hyped up to be... BUT, I will try one more time on another day with a smaller group or my bf. The soup had a thick consistency but definitely not the bold amazing flavor I am looking for. I KNOW.... because I am vietnamese. I know a good bowl of pho when I eat it.... and tonight was NOT it. 

I am sorry, but when I make my visit here again, I will review it again. 

I give 1 star for food and 2 stars for service. Service is very important to me, so they definitely derseve stars. 

Until next time.
author: Mai H.

description:
Growing up out here and I can't believe I never found this place before.  $5 for a big ol bowl of pho.  Can't beat that!  Their rice dishes are really good too.  

Not much to say other than, they are friendly, very mom n pop like, they are super cheap, and its tasty.  

I'm a fan!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
The first time i went here it was ok.

I came in today not very hungry, i actually accompanied a friend to eat. I ordered something small, shrimp spring rolls..............of DEATH!

I ate at around 3:00pm and by 8, i was getting light headed and felt like vomiting, which i eventually did....When i had first tasted it tasted off, i know i know, im stupid for eating it, but i thought it was manageable and just thought i was so used to eating spring rolls that were really good, and just thought this was a crappier one relative to all the good ones i ate, again i know i know (even my friends are amazed how ridiculous my logic is) 

My friend ordered the beef vermicelli which was actually really good, but currently, i have decided to never go back again, at least until they raise their health inspection score....... also if youre wondering, there is a pic of the very spring roll that murdered my stomach....looks tasty doesn't it??? WRONG, they'll eat your insides and make you vomit their remains...

Loi's can suck it indefinately
author: Calvinn W.

description:
Ok...this past weekend I gave Loi's another chance. I remember coming here years ago when I was in high school. My biggest concern was to use the restroom you walked through the kitchen and seeing how clean it was already gave me a stomach ache. Ugh...

I guess you could say back then I was a little more uptight than I am now. I would have automatically given Loi's a one star...dirty dirty dirty!

HOWEVER...my recent experience has changed my opinion...the pho here is actually very tasty. Not sure if its the load of msg but the broth sure was flavorful. And at $4 a bowl how can you beat that. So Cheap...

Quick service ...good food...just don't go wandering around since the kitchen/bathroom will probably make you head straight for the door.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
standard vietnamese cuisine...pho, rice plates 'n' noodles....taste 'n' quality the norm...bbq pork good...pho decent...what one expects at a good pho joint.....loi's shines in portions 'n' pricing...enormous portions...should rephrase to say "platters".....meals too large for one plate....while interiors small...chinese run....seating few....definite three star average meals had....with extra point for generous servings 'n' for low daily pricing....

**wednesdays closed**
author: Hen A.

description:
I LOVE LOI's!  I come here often and have never been disappointed.  Their Spring rolls are packed to the max and you can't beat the price.  I normally get the Pork Vermicelli with Imperial rolls but love their Pho just as much. Their Vietnamese Iced coffee goes perfectly with any meal too!  

For first timers though, you might not be impressed with its decor.  I won't lie, it's pretty hole in the wall and it's not exactly clean.  But if you're down for good Vietnamese food, this is where it's at.
author: Jamie Y.

description: Came here for the first time today with my bun rieu loving friend who raves and raves about how good & cheap lois is. Cheap it is indeed! It's like $5 for a bowl of pho! I got the bun rieu which I'm normally not too crazy about, but I must admit it is pretty tasty here. It was also boiling hot that I burned my tongue. Lol. But oh wells! We also got imperial rolls which I didn't like at all, it was too greasy and bland. Also, don't come here expecting it to be squeaky clean. I found it to have a weird smell and the utensils to be a bit grimey. Just wipe it down before using! Haha. There are also no smalls, only medium!
author: Jackie M.

description:
Sad to report that the last few times put us off Loi's -  ingredients were burned, meat super fatty and waaay to much smoke flavoring used, all in all phogettable.

2 1/2 stars
author: GIR ..

description:
Loi's is in my old 'hood - so convenient for when I crave Pho!  I'm one of those people that likes to try new things just to try them, but when I find something or someplace specifically that serves something I like, I stick to that one particular dish whenever I go to that specific place.

(um, okay, run-on sentence?)

My dish at Loi's is the BBQ beef and shrimp pho.  Like I've said before, I'm all about QUALITY, not QUANTITY (gourmet vs. gourmand), but if I like something: move over - I CAN EAT.  And, I'll have a pile of crumpled paper napkins right next to my large empty bowl.  

...Because I'm a Lady!  *dabs corners of mouth with napkin*
author: Van Ness D.

description: It's good food for the price. Don't go here if your are expecting a 3 star restaurant. Isn't the cleanest or friendly place to go eat.
author: David N.

description:
I really don't know why this place has such a high rating, unless I went on a really off night. When I came here my pho tasted like a foot. Like a dirty, stinky foot. I ate as much as I could since I was starving and left with that foot taste coating my mouth. It was GROSS! Like the worst pho ever!
The BF got a rice plate with chicken that he ate grudgingly. It was cheap, but not good in any sense of the word.
Am I missing something? I mean seriously, yelp hasn't ever steered me wrong, but there is just NO WAY that this is 4 star Vietnamese food! NO WAY!
author: Melanie V.

description:
I love this place. I always come here when I'm in the sunset area. 
Their imperial rolls and spring rolls with peanut sauce are always an appetizer hit. Their Vietnamese iced coffee is better than anything starbucks has to offer. 
Among my favorite main dishes, I love porkchop over rice with fried egg, chicken and egg pho with flat rice noodles, and their seafood vermicelli. 
I've been coming here since I was a little girl, so I know the family that owns the place. very nice and generous. 
Did I mention cheapppp and big portioned foods!?
author: A. L.

description:
My mom is visiting from the east coast, so we decided to check out this place for lunch.  It was packed for a Tuesday afternoon and the table turnover was lickety split.  Service was nice, considering that it's basically a fast food asian restaurant.

Now onto to the victuals.  Moms had the Bun Cha Ha Noi and it was okay.  I had the Pho with slices of beef and chicken.  The broth was a bit cloudy for pho, but the taste was pretty decent.  If you're into white meat chicken like me, you'll be pleased with the quantity and tenderness of the meat.  I've eaten at mucho Vietnamese restaurants in my life and this place was alright.  If I were in a pinch and was in the area, I might return, but wouldn't suggest rollin out to Loi's if my friends and I had a taste for pho.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I've not found a cheaper, better Vietnamese restaurant in California.
Why pay $12 for a bowl of pho at some hipster joint when you can eat here for half the price and talk about it for the next 5 days?

Every dish i've tried here is great. I can never decide. Awesome.
author: Marcia O.

description: If I could give this place no stars, I would.  I ordered #15, the pork bun and the meat was burnt to crisps, literally.  When I tried the noodles , it tasted like gas and bbq.  I've eaten this dish many times at various SF restaurants, and it has never tasted like gas.  I told the waiter (owner) and he said "it's bbq pork, so it's supposed to taste like that" and then dismissed me.   A lesson to myself, you get what you pay for and for 5 bucks, expect burnt inedible meat and bad customer service.  Will never come back here again.
author: Cherry L.

description:
Not bad for the price! about 5 bucks for the loi's special XL size pho

I live about 5 minutes away from this place and still enjoy going here for a nice meal thats cheap! 

Service: the servers don't seem to speak english well, but that isn't much of a concern to me...its more of the fact that they are ready to take the order and are quick. My usual routine: come in, sit where theres available (sometimes you'll sit next to strangers...awkward right?) and get my order. 
I usually have to get up to pay though. I think the whole process of just getting sat down all the way to paying my check (just eating there on my own) probably took less than 30 minutes (probably less if i ate faster). 
overall...for service 3/5

Atmosphere: It does seem a little dirty. I've needed to use the restroom which is right by the kitchen and it doesn't seem too clean either. Having to sit next to strangers sometimes is weird..so i avoid going on busy hours. Its a tiny little restaurant...and people have waited outside before to get a table. atmosphere 2/5 

Food:I usually enjoy loi's special or the bbq beef pho. I don't know too much about whats good or bad pho but I think this place isn't bad (to me..most pho tastes the same...). The bbq beef is pretty good though. 
food: 3/5 

If your not too picky of an eater or the look of the place then this place isn't too bad.
author: Paul A.

description:
The restaurant is run by Vietnamese Chinese people, but the Bun Rieu (Crab Meat Noodle Soup) was pretty good.  The bean sprouts and basil were fresh, too.  The best part was that the medium bowl I got filled me up and was only $4.25!

The service is fast, but the restaurant is really, small, so if you can, wait until after the lunch rush to eat here.

If you're wondering what Bun Rieu tastes like, it's like a cross between minestrone and cioppino with thin rice noodles.  The one at Loi's is not at all spicy, despite the redness of the soup.  It's not on the menu, so if you don't see it on the wall, ask about it.
author: Hoa Q.

description: This place has great food! Very authentic, I love the beef stew pho'! The prices are excellent too!
author: Mary T.

description: the owner got attitude problem. was complaining that i used too much of his napkins. Maybe if they clean their utensils and dishes better i wouldn't have to wipe them. Also the bathroom was horrible(ever heard of a mop?) u have to squeeze through the employees just to get in the bathroom. Trust me if u see the conditions back there u wont want to eat there.
author: Cathy M.

description:
Food is flavorful.
Friendly service.
I ordered 3 types of meat rice dish.
They didn't really have that but they knew what i wanted and accommodated.
You can do it!
author: Po L.

description:
Delicious food for an even better price! I like this place; the organized chaos in the kitchen, the efficient friendliness of the owner, the well-proportioned meals that are worth every dollar you pay (and you pay only a few). Excellent if you have no time to cook your own meal (or if you don't feel like getting your hands dirty in the kitchen).

Just wondering if the owner really is Vietnamese...

Edit (2/28/2009): Sometimes, they leave the shrimp too long on the grill, and the food is sometimes luke-warm.
author: Dennis V.

description:
Loi's is CHEAP, TASTY, AND did i say cheap already... 

They absolutely have the best Vietnamese rice plates around. The charbroiled pork, beef, chicken.. whatever it is! THEY ARE SO GOOD! The flavors are perfect and the portions are huge especially for the small price you pay.

I forgot the name of what i ordered last time i went, but it was definitely good! Charbroiled pork chops, with pork skin and Rice + add an eggroll! YUM! 

I just to come here for pho all the time, because they have a really meaty broth which will cure any hang over! They give an ample amount of noodles and beef, for a low low price! I would definitely consider loi's a dive restaurant... and one of the best!
author: Brian P.

description:
Very classic traditional decor as you walk in. Wooden table with matching wooden chairs brings me back some old memories of the Chinese restaurants in the village towns of suburban China. Keep in mind that this is the best place to get some marinated grilled chicken, but not known for their Pho. 

Food: excellent 
Decorations: Cozy, Warm, Family-like kind of feeling
Bathroom: Must walk pass the kitchen area. Very limited space. 
Service: The old man takes charge, he remembers what you order. Great service!
Parking: street. Not too bad for the area. 

I was introduced to this place by a friend. He ordered for me, so I just tried what was known to be best. We had the combo of bbq pork w/ skin, marinated grilled chicken thigh served with rice, special beef pho, and a side dish of cold shrimp spring rolls. Everything was tasty and delicious. Most importantly, this is some cheap eat!! 

I don't have any complaint in regards of the food and service at all. The only reason why I am grading this down one star is because of the cleanliness of the entire restaurant itself. The bathroom is pretty small, I think it would be a difficult challenge for anyone over 200 lbs. I am used to coming to asian restaurants with these sort of environment, so it wasn't a big deal for me. On the top notch, I would definitely visit again for the great food and would recommand anyone to try this place.

To answer the previous review: 
I believe the owner is Chinese-Vietnamese-American
author: Lisa R.

description:
Love this place.  Beware of hair in your food though!  (It happened to the person I went with the last 3 times we went, so we're on a "break" from Loi's right now, but maybe one day we'll go back and give them another shot...?)  If it's not happening to any other Yelp'ers out there, then I say give this place a try!  (Warning: Street parking is TOUGH!)

The reason I am willing to go back is that despite the hair, they are the ONLY place that will serve pho with a GRILLED meat (beef/pork/chicken) of your choice!  Anytime I ask for it anywhere else, other restaurants don't understand why I would ask for such a dish...?  One restaurant told me that it would be impossible...?!

Needless to say, the food is great and you leave with a happy tummy.  Too bad they don't have anywhere for you to wash your hands (another factor contributing to the minus 1 star).  =o(  It's good if you want QUICK, CHEAP food and aren't afraid of too many germs.
author: Jennie L.

description:
Having moved up from the LA area, home to Little Saigon and an amazing variety of Vietnamese Cuisine options, my fiancee and I were starting to miss our late night food runs out and about as well as in her mom's kitchen.  Lo and behold, we find Loi's! A gem of a gem where the patrons are all there for one reason- the food at amazing prices!  (rice plates, egg rolls, bbq chicken and pho!) 

The restaurant itself is nothing amazing (those who are looking for ambience look elsewhere) but if you're hungry and you want food resembling a home cooked meal, you're home!  We've befriended one of the waitresses at the restaurant and after asking her why the prices are so reasonable, we always try and tip her a little extra! (sorry yelpers, i don't want to disclose her answer) We'll definitely continue coming back to Loi's- our home away from home!
author: Russ N.

description: I ordered the seafood noodle soup, but was given the wrong order. A little disappointed, but as a glanced over I saw the most amazing thing ever. A plain bowl of beef noodle soup with a side of BBQ chicken and ribs. It's gleaming with the right amount of char and shouting for me to take a bite. I have yet to try it, but watch out Loi's, I'm coming back!
author: Trevor D.

description: Pho under $4.00 and Bun Rieu under $5. Need me to say more?
author: Tracy A.

description:
AHHH yes! My at least once a week meal. Loi's is a small place with about 8 tables, but they serve you incredibly fast. Your soup will come to you before you even have time to get comfy in your seat. No PHO ever tasted this good!!! I usually just get the #2 (always delicious) sometimes I like to get the bbq meat and noodles or rice. Its good but if you go there go for the pho! 

Just don't mind the servers screaming at each other, just think of it as family dinner with your Vietnamese side :/ 

GOOD PHO!  
Oh and did I say that it's also the cheapest pho in the city, well the cheapest I've encountered it.
author: Kristina S.

description:
Um, I really don't understand why this place has a 4 star rating.  

Came here back in September08, still on a mission to find good SF pho.  By first impression, the "decor" was truly 3rd world country.. but the restaurant was packed so we thought it must be one of those hole-in-the-walls serving cheap, amazing food.  

Two of us order pho, while the other orders vermicelli.  I swear, one minute, ONE MINUTE after we place our orders, my friend gets his bowl of vermicelli handed to him.  UMM.. shady much??  

While the vermicelli seemed to taste o.k., my friend and I concurred the pho itself was terrible.  IT WAS THE WORST PHO I HAD EVER EATEN IN MY LIFE.  The texture of the noodles were off and the broth tasted unlike anything I previously had.  It's hard to describe, kinda oily and bland.. like something I imagined dishwater to taste like.  I could not finish it.

Not surprisingly, later that evening my friend who had the vermicelli informed us he'd started vomiting and had to call in sick to work.

Attempt #2 to find good SF pho: fail. MAJOR EPIC FAIL.
author: Jennie L.

description: I love coming here when I am ballin on a budget. The portion sizes are great for the price you pay. If you want to get your vietnamese fix, this is the place to be. The rice plates and pho are both delicious without denting the wallet. I will continue to come here because the food is always consistent and satisfies my needs.
author: Matthew H.

description: This guy is so surly that I'll happily pay a few bucks more for someone to be nice. The food is okay, but I just can't justify the service or the cleanliness for the cheap prices. I'll happily go to Kevin's, PPQ, and spend a few more bucks for nicer people, and better atmosphere. I'm not looking for white linens, but after several tries, and too many dirty looks from this dude, I'm done.
author: Gwenn G.

description:
For the most part this place can easily be described as a hole in the wall. barely having enough sets to fit a couple of dozen people at most and with their old style decor, one would seriously question how clean this place can be. With that said however this is by far one of the cheapest Pho places you can find anywhere these days. If you come here with a friend and have a small appetite you can easily get outta here spending less than 6 bucks at most for one person. I love how their menu may be small but they offer great rice dishes along with the traditional Pho soup. I know there are many other places along the street that people like going to more, but at the same time I just want friendly service without the massive amounts of people in there.

If your really worried about the health score, don't be. They have improved a lot over the course of the past few years so it's a testimony to see how Chinese places can have scores over 80! It may not be the best place to take a date, but it is a cool place to take some friends and have some fun at the same time. Your gonna get here what you would get anywhere else and have the option of ordering specifically how much you want. Trust me and come here when you have the chance to, you wont regret it.
author: Jason Y.

description:
One of those hole-in-the-wall places...Interesting, I decided to go to this pho place instead of my usual Pho Hoa Hiep (see my review, if you want to learn more) because it smelled so good. The place was small, a little dingy looking, but pleasant. It was an okay environment...but it had a peculiar smell..maybe next time take-out?? 

Anway, I got my usual beef pho...it was good. The broth was a little on the salty side, but the medium size was just perfect for me...no leftovers. =) My friend got the same, but I did see some neighboring tables with some pretty good-looking rice plates piled high with food. Maybe next time? ;)
author: Alison N.

description:
Working on Irving Street has its benefits. You know whats good and whats not. Working on Irving 40+ hours a week, you know what hits the spot after a long day. This restaurant is great. I've been comming here 6+ years, since High School. I always order the Pho and the Misses order the rice plates. 

I don't mind walking 4 blocks to pick up my Pho when I could be getting it across the street from the other places. Yea, its true, the owners yell and bitch at each other, but who wouldn't? Thats Asian style. He sometimes hook me up with free egg rolls, but thats cause I let him use my bathroom one time.

If you read this review, go try it out. Not the cleaniest place, or alot of room, but the food is great. A nice family owned business that gets 5+ stars. Tell Mr. Loi I said hi and i'm planning to go there sometime this week.
author: David L.

description:
*CASH ONLY* 

this is definitely a type of hole in the wall restaurant, i mean this place IS dirty but omg the pho beef broth was delicious!  i dunno if i was insane or what that day but it's really cheap food that tasted good.  

yea yea, i was bit hesitant to go in because my boyfriend told me its dirty but he eventually persuaded me  lol  i'm glad we tried that place, the broth was very flavorful, ordered #1 pho, my usual  hehe  one of the cheapest pho places i've gone by far
author: mea f.

description:
I've been going to this place since 1998!  The food tastes good and is cheap.  The wait is never too long and the waiter always knows what I'm going to order haha.  Just a random fact, he's been wearing that same sweater vest and slacks for 10 years straight!  I would think that after giving ten years of business and lots of money in tips that he would buy some new clothes ;-) But in all seriousness, I highly recommend this place.

My favorites:

Vietnamese egg rolls

#29 Beef and shredded pork with rice

Chicken noodle soup!
author: Ciana P.

description:
PHO in the hole! I'm always on the look out for awesome Viet places...this one fits the cake and the PRICE!  You def CANNOT go wrong with the price...

On another note...my party of eight surprisingly fit in this tiny place - come at a down time or you will surely be waiting!  We were there late - so no big deal.  Pho was pretty good - i had the beef and chicken (bits of chicken fat never hurt) and my friend had the beef noodle which he killed...and everyone who ordered the rice plate left satisfied...the vermicelli people did not finish however - but they indicated they were full, so i'm guessing adequate portion size.

Go PHO!
author: Julie H.

description: eggrolls are delicious.  pho ga broth is so tasty you can drink it!  beef pho also another popular bowl.
author: Ju D.

description:
whoaaaa 4 dollars for a Medium bowl of pho with everything!?!? wahhh thats like....O_O yes very cheap. you'd think you would be getting really little or really nasty stuff.

BUT! it was actually pretty tasty, a good amount too. my dad likes it here. yes it is small, and a bit dirty, but we all clean and wipe our utensils anyways, and i havent had a tummyache from that place so i assume its alright. 

we also had a plate of bbq beef on the side and it was good too, 20 bucks plus tip for 3 ppl? awesomee. parking was easy and food comes out fast.
author: Christine M.

description:
First, I think the name Loi is sexy, and this dirty small shop has some salty and base pho that is oddly appealing the way junk food is.  If you're tired of the elegant clear broths of better pho, come here.  They have a wonderful motto "EAT HERE OR TO GO".

Loi's gets two stars (from a base of three) because I'll come here once in a while if I'm feeling really nasty!
author: Amanibhavam K.

description: This place reminds me of the Soup Nazi from Seinfeld. I go there with a fear of getting yelled at. Yet, the food is so good that I keep going back. Last week, I have actually witnessed the waitress yelled at a customer in Chinese and the customer just silently sat there taking her insults. She just wanted to eat her pho. What is going on?
author: Ting R.

description: My friend had been hyping up Loi's for the longest time, so coming into the restaurant, I was expecting magic on my taste buds. It wasn't exactly magical, but it was definitely good and lived up to the hype. For its price, I seriously doubt that there's a better place to get pho around the sunset.
author: Nathaniel C.

description:
Food:I had high hopes for Loi's but unfortunately I didn't enjoy my take out meal today.I ordered a large chicken noodle soup. The portions were nice, however I didn't expect there to be chicken that was clearly still raw....I know that some pho places give you raw meat (like thin slices of beef) so that when you eat it you can cook it in your broth...however I didn't expect it for takeout or for chicken. I guess I'm used to my chicken being cooked? Anyways,the broth was okay too, not much flavor.

Service:Service was fast and friendly but I don't think I'd return.

Atmosphere: Small and kind of dirty looking...

Price: Cheap!

Location: Right on Irving st, down near where Baskin Robbins is/ or used to be.
author: Miss H K.

description:
I give this place 5 full stars because of quality + price. .

The pho broth is pretty good and they have a good meat-to-noodle ratio.   I really think their meats in general is good.  Either the beef in their pho or the BBQ meats they have (mm...bbq beef) or the chicken in their pho ga, it's always guaranteed to be tasty

 I order the smallest bowl they have (I simply can't finish the larger sizes =P) and it's $3.95.  The beauty is if you do order a larger, they don't just add more soup and noodle like some other places may. They actually size up all the ingredients.  

The only down side is that the place is small, a little dinky, and though I've never had to walk into their kitchen as other Yelpers may have, I can understand their hesitation.  Still, this is my pho home.  I've loved it since I was in high school (or even before?), and I still love it now.
author: Bernadette C.

description:
omg such good pho for so cheap ! its def a hole in the wall kind of place and sorta dingy and seats are scarce and cramped but the food is amaziiing or the broth is. ihardly had to add anything into it because it was already pretty perfect . the wait isnt long. u get in u eat and then u get out. Portions are the right amount. its just really good food for a good price. 

beware tho they close shop once they run outta the broth so come early or not too late
author: Lee H.

description:
beware- BIG PORTIONS- I had to struggle to finish my food! Ordered the crab and shrimp paste noodle soup, was thinking of ordering the medium, then was convinced by my man to order the large and he would help me out with his XL pho. He couldnt finish his! 

This place was run by the sweetest old couple. Nice and homey. A bit snug indoors- we came in at the right time and got seated right away. This is not the kind of place you'd wanna hang out and sip tea all night, so the turnover of patrons is quick and I can say worth the wait, Next time we'll get the rice plates- sounds good from the other reviewers, but it was hecka cold tonight and we needed some soupy goodness!

Prices are really good, food was very satifying and with the great service, leaving a good tip was worth it!
author: Sushi Y.

description:
How can I ever say no to cheap food? I love the pho they have at this place, maybe it's because my mom has raised me on fish sauce, but their pho downright hits the spot for me. Definitely not the cleanest, but I find it somewhat homey! I always order the pho bo vien and every time I've liked it. It's literally a steal (for me at least) 'cause its like 4 dollars a bowl and it's a filling bowl!!! Mm, what's better than a steaming bowl of pho on a cold, foggy SF day? absolutely NOTHING. And of course, it's right next to Teaway, soo (: I love this place, though the man behind the cashier can be kind of intimidating from time to time. My sister tried to make small talk with him one time and he just nodded with this annoyed face. lol, he always seems like that, so i never bother trying to strike up a conversation. The ladies are nice though, they're all smiley, asian women. :D And it  probably can't fit a party with 8 or more, so I don't recommend bringing a bunch of ppl here at the same time. haaha.

Soooo,

Go for the food, not the ambiance. :p
author: Chia W.

description:
Food is amazingly good and cheap but this place definitely isn't getting a good rating for service and for cleanliness. 

Boyfriend took me here because I wanted to check out Tea Way after hearing my friends rave about it on Twitter. BUT it was also a rainy and cold and the pho place near our school is closed on Tuesdays so I quickly yelped this place up. All the tables were taken so they offered us to sit us with some strangers. If I was with my dad, I would've but since I was with my boyfriend, we requested our own table. They seemed fine with that. We ordered an XL bowl of #1 (Loi's Special Beef Pho) and a #35 rice plate (BBQ Beef and BBQ Pork over Rice). I mainly ordered the special beef pho because I love beef balls in my pho and the worker told me there would be as long as I didn't order the medium. I thought that would be perfect because I was planning to share anyways but there was only ONE in the entire bowl! :( I also asked the worker (old male) for refills on our hot tea (I drink a lot of tea) and he just looked at me. I didn't know if he heard me because he didn't acknowledge me at all but he did refill our glasses. At least the food was really good and cheap.

Note: There were peanuts on top of our rice plate. There's no notice on the menu at all so if you're allergic to peanuts, BE SURE TO TELL THEM!
author: Danielle Cheri R.

description:
3 medium bowls of pho plus a soymilk plus added fishballs in my pho (yes, I'm strange, not that strange because the guy taking my order wasn't surprised or confused) and the check came to just under $14. $14. 3 bowls of pho. It blows my mind. 

 They don't have the pho tai that I usually order at other pho restaurants, just some...kinda beef pho with a bunch of stuff and then their special beef pho with a bunch of stuff. I think their special has less than the regular. Their rare slices of beef were kind of weird, they seemed like they'd been ground up and were a little bit chewy. But my medium bowl of their special pho was $3.95 and then I added $1 worth of fishballs.

Their pho is tasty and you really can't beat the price. It's not the best pho but it's the best pho for the price.
author: Tiff L.

description: I absolutely love this place and I knoow this place can be a bit jank a lank but the food never fails. it's soo affordable and I always get a number 1. or I'll get the five spice chicken over rice or I'll get the roasted pork over rice or i'll get the one with the crab meat. Whatever I just get a bunch of stuff. Sometimes maybe all the time the owner and his wife always argue but when you've been there as many times as I have you'll get used to it. It's all good because it's about the food.
author: Julie Z.

description:
This is one of my favorite pho places in the sunset.  Its one of those hole in the wall resturants, but you can definitely tell that everyone who goes there are from the neighborhood and know the owners pretty well.  Both the rice plates AND the pho are good!  The place may look small and not very clean but the taste is definitely authentic!

Service is ok....I mean you don't really go to these places for the service, so I don't want to penalize them for that.  You pretty much pay for what you get.  Plus, if you don't understand Chinese/Vietnamese, you might think that they're always arguing...but in fact, that's just the way they talk.
author: susie b.

description:
Ok, so I have to admit that though I have frequented Loi's for nearly two decades (yeah, I'm an old fart), it isn't technically my first choice for pho. However, the owners of this restaurant, the Lois, really went above and beyond the call of duty, and I want people to know the experience I had here. 

The food itself is very "home-style" if not exactly authentic. Their beef is sliced differently than most pho places, which makes it more tender so long as you keep it from over-cooking in the broth. They serve beer, and they often play Chinese movies on an LCD television near the ceiling (if you want to watch though, you will have to face the door--there's only one tv!). They also serve soymilk that is slightly bland, but very reminiscent of hole-in-the-walls in Hong Kong. 

The reason Loi's has pushed over into 5 stars is their amazing service, mainly on Mrs. Chen Tu Loi's end. She not only was quick to greet and assist one of the elderly in my party, but she remembered what our orders were, even though we had not frequented the restaurant in nearly 5 years! She also prevented a mishap when my grandma attempted to take a hot bowl of soup on her own. Mrs. Loi really blew my mind that day. She was at all times gracious, respectful, and full of smiles. Big up Loi's!
author: Esther L.

description: what's not to like?  a LARGE bowl of pho with lots of meat and noodles for $4.75?  Or you can splurge and get the XL for $0.50 more.  but a large is more than enough.  Pho is not the greatest, but it's better than most and can't beat the speed and price.  Small place, so best to go off peak hours to get in and out fast...and whatever you do, don't look in the kitchen, less you probably won't want to eat there.  but hey, you say that about any hole-in-the-wall restaurants.
author: Jason Y.

description:
I'm from San Jose, and you know that's the City of Pho! Besides my mom's pho, this place was pretty decent. 

You pay like 5-6 bucks for a huge bowl of not so bad pho, what more can you ask for?

The turn off was it's dirty looking and in one sitting my boyfriend found two hairs in his pho bowl. We still go there because of the pho.
author: Tam T.

description:
If you're looking to try good Vietnamese food, this is the place to go. This restaurant is pretty authentic even if the restaurant itself doesn't look appealing. The place is very small with only a few tables and chairs (which appears to be fairly sticky too). It's pretty loud in there if you dine in. If you're looking for a neat, quiet place to eat at, this is not for you (but definitely order to go to give the food a try.) Even though this place had a hygiene/ health score on the low side before, they have now significantly improved their score.

I've been eating here since I was a little kid and I've been coming back. There's a large variety of Appetizers, Pho, Cold Vermicelli, Rice plates, etc to choose from. This place is even better because the pricing is beyond reasonable. You'd spend no more than about $6 or $7 for a huge bowl/ plate of food. Give the place a try! :D
author: Janice M.

description:
All though there were a gang of flies, this place was not the sh*t.

After reading all the hyped up reviews on Yelp talking all this yip yap I slid thru on a Tuesday around 3pm. Got a large Pho Tai and knew instantly this wasn't the truth of the matter. Prices are low. The quantity was there. The taste was just decent. No cohesiveness to it though ... good broth, tough meat, and al dente noodles ... might give it another shot if low on funds.

In the end I walked away with a semi-full stomach and some change for a bowl of redemption Pho elsewhere.




.
author: Steve H.

description:
Wow...a 4-star average. I'm surprised! Loi's is definately a mom and pop pho shop, its small, cheap and tasty. Its not much different from your average PPQ, but it is extraordinarily small in here. I feel like it could only fit 10 people in here comfortably. The place itself is dirty and janky, but if  you want good pho and don't have much $ in your wallet, you can get out of here stuffed and satisfied for a mere $5.

edit 6/23/08: I recently heard that Loi's was on the radio the other day, but it wasnt good press...apparently it had received a 40% out of 100% for its health inspection scorecard.....even with this knowledge, I still see plenty of people dining @ Loi's...I guess what they say is true, there's no such thing as bad press.
author: Jessica h.

description:
At the request of my girlfriend, I came here to try her favorite beef broth pho. And for just that dish, its absolutely amazing. And its absolutely cheap too.

-The place is super small. Kind of a hole in the wall. And dirty as hell, but God made dirt so dirt don't hurt. Deal with it.
-The old lady that buses the tables is super crabby. Haha, we sat down, ordered #2 (Lois Beef Broth Pho or something) and #28 (BBQ pork and rice). And she yells the numbers at us like "TWO! TWENTY EIGHT!" I don't know if that was for our benefit or what...
-So the beef broth pho was really good. The tripe was really tender. And the broth is delicious. A must try!!
-The rice dish on the other hand, was so-so. The pork mix on top of the rice wasn't the best I've had and it didn't come with freakin' pickled veggies that these rice dishes usually do. Argh!
-Two main issues 1. They didn't have that red chili oil that comes in the small container on the side of every table in pho restaurants. I usually mix the hoisin sauce, sriracha, soy sauce and the chili paste and use that as a dip for stuff. Anyways, they didn't have it, kinda disappointing. 2. The bean spouts that they gave us were a little wilted. No biggie, its just an annoyance. 
-The food is amazingly cheap tho. For a large bowl of pho, an eggroll, and a rice plate, it was $13. 

Come here and try the pho. I'm not even recommending it, I'm telling you that you have to eat the pho. It's so cheap and fast, you'll be missing out if you don't.
author: Aron L.

description:
this is one of those places i pass by a gazillion times & never go in. i decided to come here after yelping a bit. 

from the outside, it isn't big or noticeable. you would probably pass it without knowing.

this place feels very china-ese, like something you would see in a chinese movie. even when i went to china, it wasn't like this...or i don't remember any place like this...or just didn't go to any like this...

so small, cramped, actually i've ate at smaller spaces.

cheap good food. where else can you get pho for less than $5????

i had a large #1, it was good. not great, but i'd come back for a cheap pho fix.
author: Kylie L.

description: They are pretty good, and hella cheap. The dining area's being really small and crowded lends a certain air of charm (like that of a Parisian hooker) to the restaurant as well. I heartily recommend that you try this place out!
author: Elbert C.

description:
This place is actually pretty good.. it's kind of dirty but the food is good. You don't get your pho as fast as other places but its worth the wait. This place is really really small too with only like 6 tables. Prices are low, the food is good and parking sucks! lol!

My best memory at this place was when i was eating with my friend and a asian man sitting at the table next to us let on rip and boy did he rip one.. that shit echoed! LOL oohh.. i was dying of laughter.. good times good times..=)
author: Heather C.

description: The pho here is really good and the soup is legit unlike most Viet restaurant which serves MSG soup. This place is definitely a hole in a wall. Where else in SF sells medium pho for $3.95? No where! Their eggrolls are delicious as well. The ice Viet coffee are strong and not watered down. Just to warn you, the owner (guy with grey hair) has a lot of attitude. Just know what you want and you'll be fine.
author: Jewels Y.

description: Want good Vietnamese food at a cheap price? Go to this place. You can get a large noodle soup for $5.00! A few of their other dishes are pretty good as well. The service and personality of the owner and staff is much to be desired, but what do you expect when paying so little for so much food. In short go for the cheap eats but don't expect 5 star service.
author: Calvin C.

description:
A tiny hole in the wall with some really tasty pho.  The flavor of the soup is somewhat different from that served in other pho restaurants.  It's got a little "tap water" flavor that some may find unappealing.  It's also very much on the salty side.  I, however, very much enjoy these flavors as strange as it may sound.  

The place itself is really small and I prefer getting take-out.
author: Carol Y.

description:
Pho Tai w/Special Beef... that's all I ever need to fill my Pho craving.  This place is one of the few place that serves this dish where the beef is not just sliced rare steak... it's different.  Those who have had this dish know what I'm talking about.  This place was an easy choice again and again during my Lowell days.

Downsides I'm sure everyone has mentioned already:
-Hella small; don't bother coming with more than 4 people, or even more than 2 if you are big people
-Filthy floors, and semi-filthy tables.  Legit though, HA

Upsides:
-Cheap
-Portions

To try:
-Pho Tai w/Special Beef
-BBQ Pork over Rice
author: Warren L.

description:
My friends love to go here, for its cheap price and delicious food. It does have both, but place is just so sketchy.

This place is cramped and dirty - I remember tons of ants crawling on the walls, the utensils, and my table. Creeeepy.

The first time I came here, the owners made a huge scene because their daughter had an F on her report card. It was literally yelling and screaming and crying, in front of everybody, for about 20 minutes. They had no respect for their customers. The second time I came here, the owner took our order while he was on the phone. Again, no respect, and very unprofessional.

Do expect delicious food if you decide to come here. But be cautious - after seeing those ants, who wouldn't question what's in your noodle soup?
author: Tiffany T.

description: The food here is super tasty and super cheap!!! I've been here several times now and every time I go, i get something different. the soup noodles are my favorites. I have tried the ones with vinegar dressing and rice noodle but the soup ones are the best. Regardless of what other people say, the soup base is real! made with real meat and bones. If you haven't been in their kitchen; they have a gigantic pot boiling with a lot of bones and meat simmering on the stove.
author: Meiling W.

description:
I used to go to this place all the time when my girlfriend lived in the area. It doesn't look like the cleanest place I know but the food is pretty bomb still. It's good quality broth and thats all you can ask for from a small family business. 

Once when I was there with my friends I noticed the scorecard at the front of the store. . . never look at it if you got love for this place! Cause unfortunately I did and it was a forty-deuce! Haven't gone back to "Loi's Fohty-Wada" since! But my last meal there was still good! Heard the score card went up so I might have to hit it up again! Holla!
author: Kazuaki K.

description:
This place is reasonably priced, beyond reasonable even, to the point of wondering how they can make a profit in San Francisco.

I'll admit - I am not a pho fan.  So when I go Vietnamese, I go bbq meat.  Their BBQ beef over rice is fantastic, and for only $5-something ($6-somthing with an egg roll), how can you go wrong?  Especially considering the left overs will cover lunch.  I love the flavor, and when it comes to spices I can be pretty picky. 

Speaking of egg rolls - fantastic.  Too greasy for my taste but again, for this price and this quantity even a picky person can not complain.  I think it's the sauce that makes it all so wonderful.  

I would only suggest takeout here, it's very hole-in the wall and the restaurant def. serves to a small group of people (as in, if you are the type of people it serves to you probably know who you are already).  

It seems like I see the same people (husband and wife?)  there every time I go, and they work hard; something am-9:30 pm every day.  So please, even if you are doing take out.  Tip well!  They deserve it.  And trust me, when you tip people remember you - and they show appreciation ;).
author: Rachel M.

description:
Just stumbled upon this gem a few weeks ago. All my friends had been raving about this place so i decided to check it out.

Loi's is a total hole in the wall. Typical Irving street restaurant. But holy cow, their pho is good. It tastes quite different from other pho places, but i just can't quite get my finger on how it's different.... But it's different in a good way! And 4.75 for a large bowl of pho!?!? count me in! How the hell is this place so cheap!?!???! IT MAKES NO SENSE!

Anyways, the pho is awesomely good and the price just makes it that much better! Go now!
author: Darryl C.

description: Good, cheap, fast pho! You can get a good meal for $4! Can't beat that.
author: Brittany G.

description: I SERIOUSLY LOVE LOIS hahaha this pho restaurant is like one of those hole in the wall restaurants. Looks may be deceiving. They give LARGE portions for CHEAP. and its not NASTY its YUMMY (: this would be my number one pick on irving. it'd be Lois, Kevins, then PPQ
author: Kristina L.

description:
hmmm... I'm really quite surprised that people have given this place a bad rating. This has to be my favorite pho/vietnamese place to eat at, perhaps I am biased because this was the first vietnamese restaurant I had ever gone to back when I was a wee cub, but I have eaten at quite a few pho places since. 

Quick recap of the places where I have eaten vietnamese food: SF, Mountain View CA, Cupertino CA, Sunnyvale CA, Los Angeles CA, Alhambra CA, Davis CA, Monterey Park CA, Paris France, Lyon France, Nice France, London England, Geneva Switzerland, Taipei Taiwan oh and can't forget Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam, Hanoi Vietnam, 

So needless to say, where ever this bear travels, he makes it a point to try the vietnamese food there. And yes I don't know why but still prefer this place. Nothing beats their BBQ pork with chicken with pork skin over rice, or their number 1 pho or their egg roles, and perhaps the food is a bit greasy, and the restaurant is a bit dingy but man, you can't really call yourself a foody if you don't try this place when you are in San Francisco.
author: Ian L.

description: Food is unbelievably cheap. Taste pretty good for a 4 dollar bowl of noodle soup. Its a bit small and dirty but cant complain cause you get what you pay for (:
author: Audrey C.

description:
I am no pho expert, but I do love my noodles, and loi's does a mean noodle. rich, flavorful broth, so salty.... perfectly cooked noodles... such a plethora of well made, generous toppings (I do luv my tripe thiiiiinly sliced). 

take out only. the place is trash and dirty. eat at home with your own, clean, sriracha.
author: Sasha R.

description:
PHO-licious!!!

The Pho is good, rice plate is good, whats not good??? (the restroom haha)

Cheap, and good.

Ask for the chicken sauce
author: Michael L.

description: Hole in the wall restaurant, so dont expect it to be clean and fancy. Small and crowded restaurant. Loi's gets down! Tasty, cheap food. Got the Vietnamese BBQ pork with vermicelli. Good portion and I paid only $5.20 total. Amazing!
author: Na'ala C.

description: ok it's not the BESTEST pho in the city, but i do believe it's the CHEAPEST. where else can you get a bowl of pho for $4??? no where! service is mediocre, but i guess it's the prices right? the guy yelled at me for asking for fish sauce without hot sauce, then a glass of cold water, then to have the bean sprouts cooked. he'll get over it!
author: Vanessa K.

description: Loi's!!!!  Some of the most delicious Vietnamese food in town!  I discovered this little hole in the wall about 6yrs ago when I lived in the Outer Sunset and I have been a loyal customer ever since. Don't let the looks fool you, the food here is AWESOME! Their meats are marinated and grilled to perfection.  The pho is flavorful and cheap.  I think a bowl costs $5.75.  Cheap eats at it's best!
author: Mackenzie C.

description:
one thing I have to say is  - don't dredge the bottom of the bowl. 
There have been many a time when i was so enraptured by the yummy broth and tasty beef that I have found myself dredging the bottom of the bowl for every last tasty morsel. 

Bad idea. why? you become so over full that you waddle your way out - only to need to desperately pee like 20 minutes later. (think niagra falls bursting through a damn.)

Other than that, i Love, love, love, love this place. I've become a regular there (thanks to my sis for introducing me to Loi's) so I guess I get special treatment now. 

I've even managed to turn many a nay-sayer on to the place. Even people who swear up and down that they would never eat Vietnamese food are now regulars too. So yay to Loi's for keepin it honest.
author: Kira G.

description: Ridiculously inexpensive and delicious pho, especially the one with stew. Unfriendly, but super fast service. I don't think I've ever had such cheap cheap cheap and delicious pho! Place is a bit dirty, but just keep your hands and arms off the sticky table.
author: Joy C.

description: This place is not for gourmets. But the food is very tasty, the portions are good, and very important in these inexpensive places: When I went to the bathroom, I took a look at the kitchen and looked clean. A nice soup inside the fog darkness is rewarding.
author: Javi V.

description:
I have been eating at Loi's since 1990, and I must say that it has been my place for my comfort food. If $200 is all you have for one meal a day for everyday for the month (20% tips included), this is the place to eat. If you order #1 large "PHO" on the menu, you will get all sort of goodies, soup base is amazing, temperature is just right. and you might wonder how this restaurant could survive with their pricing. The price was around $4.50 almost 30 years ago, now it is about $5.50 for the same size serving, ouch!!!

If Loi's charges more money for their dishes, 3.5 stars, but for how amazingly affordable and tasty the dishes are, definitely 4.5 stars without any complaint whatsoever. I would still go eat at Loi's even if they charge $9 for their #1 large PHO today as I love their soup base, but they are not charging that amount at all, so enjoy the super low pricing while it last.

After reading all the other reviews, I must say that "the look and feel of Loi's could be deceiving", as I have NEVER got sick once in the past 28 years eating at Loi's, and they also have a health department inspection score of over 80 out of 100, My dinning experience for almost 30 years at Loi's speaks volume.
author: Mango N.

description: Great broth in the Pho, the place is tiny and rustic, and had a fish sauce aroma about it.  The service was quick and the pho rocked.  Didn't try anything else I would go back pho sure!
author: Mickey D.

description:
You know, overall not bad, in fact pretty damn good!

Went here because of the Yelp recommendation and it didn't dissapoint.  Really good authentic PHO, and at the INSANELY cheap price everyone was talking about in their reviews.  Easily the best PHO place i've been to in the city.

I got the numer 1 Beef special PHO which was really good, just without the beef ball :-p.  Plus its definitely a mom/pop kind of establishment which is sooo great about this city.  

It did get one star off because they charged 50 cents for their to-go boxes and people were ordering food around us that wasn't on the menu (local thing i guess) but it would have been nice to know about them.  

I definitely Recommend this place!
author: Mark R.

description:
Loi's is great, its cheap, tastes great, and the portions are much bigger than the other Viet places I've been to. Which is exactly why I've been coming here for the past 5 years.

My favorite dishes are are the #1 XL and the #27 which you can get for under $7 including tax and tip.

But there's one problem, and that's the cleanliness. Now this doesn't really matter to me since I'm not a health freak or germaphobe but to those of you who are you may want to bring some hand wipes or something.

But overall Loi's is a really great place to eat at so you should definitely check it out!
author: Terrence C.

description: Been coming here for about the last 15 years. Love it. Cheap, delicious, what more can you ask for! I usually get egg rolls with the BBQ pork over rice noodles. Their pho is awesome too!
author: Patra H.

description: Who  doesn't want tasty cheap pho?? I've come here quite a number of times & I tend to order their chicken noodle soup, which only costs less than 5 bucks! Their BBQ pork with rice noodle and imperial egg roll , is mouth wateringgg!!!! In my opinion, their BBQ pork is so good , it's like eating Korean BBQ except the fact that loi's is sooo much cheaper! That order would be about less than 6 bucks! Service, not so great. The old man ALWAYS gives us a rude attitude & mark this, EVERYTIME we ask for 3-4 cups of water , he ends up giving us one. Justttt one. -_- but then again, food is great, so u can't really do anything lol! This pho resturant is defintely one of the best in San francisco, so give it a try!! :D
author: Anne C.

description: A tiny hole in the wall but hey the pho is good and they're SUPER cheap.  I don't know any other pho place that you can get a small pho for under 5 bucks!  I'm just going to eat here instead of the other pho places on irving because why pay more for the same thing?
author: Ann H.

description:
I love their beef broth and this is one of my favorite pho restaurant. 

However, the restaurant is dirty with sticky seats and stains on utensils. But the place is cheap so can't expect too much. 

I don't really like the owner because he used to yell at his daughter in the restaurant all the time. And he wouldn't change my food when he gets my order wrong.
author: Lynn S.

description:
I do not dare to step inside the kitchen/bathroom but I heard that the bathroom is the size of a table.  I don't want to ruin my appetite and love for my favorite Vietnamese hole in the wall :)

Get number 1 or number 2 (I don't know the difference-- can someone tell me?) in size M for only $3.95!!!  The beef laid on top of the noodles is raw so make sure you sink it into the soup for awhile before consuming.  The broth is extremely herby and flavorful!  I love!  $10 can usually feed two :D
author: Connie P.

description: I ordered  #1 Pho beef noodle soup with combination.  It doesn't taste like Pho at all.  My friend agreed with me that it tasted bland.  I ate here all the time but this time was just awful.  I know what Pho taste like.  If you're out of beef soup, let me know so I can order something else.  Sorry, only 2 stars for you....
author: Thanh L.

description:
Their food is incredible!
This is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant thus far. 
My favorite dish is #26 Com Heo Nuong (B.B.Q. pork over rice) with egg roll. 
I also like their iced coffee, Cafe sua (nong hay da).

The prices are excellent too and the staff is very friendly.
author: Larry J.

description:
This place is so dirty it's disgusting.  There are flies everywhere in the dining section so I can't imagine what goes on in the kitchen WHERE THEY MAKE YOUR FOOD.

Besides, this is yet another "Vietnamese food made by Chinese for Chinese" place in SF.  If you want real Vietnamese food that's made by Vietnamese for Vietnamese, I guess you'd have to trek down to San Jose.
author: P B.

description:
I was not impressed. I don't mind dives as long as the food is good. Here I just felt like I was suffering for no reason. 

Figuring I might as well go all out, I ordered a drink even though the waitress couldn't tell me what it was (Nuoc Sin Mui??). More suffering ensued. I'm here at the restaurant writing this, wondering if I should just end it all.
author: Senor Q.

description:
This is a cramped, noisy, dive.  You might get seated at the same table with strangers.  The picnic tables are a little dirty. The bathroom is disgusting.  If you go between 5:30-6, you get the priviledge of watching Loi and his family slurp noddles on a table covered in newspaper while they watch some static-burdened Asian tv on the bunny ears.

But this is a really, really good place to eat.  The pho is good; if you're not pho crazy, go to the back of the menu and order some rice and bbq dishes.  I'm partial to the pork over rice.

If you've lived in Asia, or maybe traveled on the cheap there, this is a place you'll want to know about.  Otherwise, maybe go somewhere else.
author: Jim N.

description:
this place has the best beef pho in the city, hands down! the soup is really good and the beef is GREAT. Make sure to get the chopped beef and not the thinly sliced one though. The chopped beef is thicker and more like steak, the thin beef cooks too fast and gets dry. the extra large pho is under 6 dollars. their beef stew is really good too, but it gets soggy really fast.  I don't know anywhere you can get pho this cheap and this good. 
note: this is not a very good place to get pho ga. If you come here, just have the stuff with beef in it, because the chicken broth isn't that good.
author: Ale x.

description:
ALL ABOUT THE BROTH.
the combination plates are plentiful and delicious. -- for two different kinds of large meat portions, and a bowl of pho?..for under 7.50.
amazing.
     Yes, bathroom is scary. are you there to get a quick bite and get out, or to critique the place on stuff that matters not if you are just going in for a quick bite.
this place is that --along with fast service, and a smile.
author: Rick H.

description: I'm giving them a 3 for their cheap prices. It's hella cheap. It does the deed. But by no means should you call this pho. It's some other hybrid of pho and hu tieu (another Viet dish). Still, it's less than $4 bucks and it's alright.
author: c t.

description: This place reminds me of eating pho and other noodle soups with my family in the early 90s on a Saturday morning where it's DELICIOUS AND CHEAP.  But instead of rewinding back 15 years to the TL (or paying for overpriced Vietnamese food today), I can just head over to the sunset to find this lovely little dive.  LOVE IT.
author: Arama M.

description:
100% real beef broth, no MSG, egg rolls for 1$ add-on to pho
This place is BOMB.
iv'e tried many pho places in SF. Loi's is top 3 for sure.
just talking about it makes me wanna go there lol.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
author: Jonathan L.

description:
cheap cheap cheap. 

that's all I can say, but it is cheap in a good way, not cheap oh-so-nasty.

The price is reasonable, the old man who served us was a nice guy.
The Pho is okay, the selections are not a lot.

The place is nice, small but very home-y. 
With so many pho along the street, it is really hard to choose.

This place is not SUPER DUPER good, but definitely special.
author: Marlis T.

description:
i'm a newcomer to this place.  and boy do I wish I had tried it when I moved here 12 years ago.  Could have saved me some serious cash.

Sometimes I am looking for a smallish meal when i'm on lunch breaks from work.   for 3.95 (That's tax included mind you(EDIT:no tax being charged was a fluke...tax is not included)) i get a medium bowl of pho, (chopped meat + tendons for me).   I dare someone to find me a cheaper bowl of pho.  Especially one with a real stock.   I saw the lady stirring the meat-n-bones around in the big pot.    Also, they are really nice, even to newcomers like me. (EDIT: I've noticed that they can be really rude to certain people... not sure what the reasoning is... certain asian customers get treated really bad)

I had to drop a star because I am no longer in love with it.  I think i was wowed by the price, but it isn't really the greatest.   The beef stew is still great (though super fatty).
author: howard t.

description:
I use to come here a lot to eat pho. 

All of the dishes are okay, they taste like the standard pho dish. You really can't mess that up. 

That would earn them 3 stars. 

Unfortunately, this place is DIRTY! 

I don't mind rinky dinky dirty asian restaurants - because usually those are the best, but this one is way past the line. 

I've seen mice on a few accounts at this place, but that didn't bother me as much as the server. The server put his stanky as thumb in my soup - bandage and all! 

I can only imagine what was under his band aid. But I sear, each and every time I order pho here, this guy has his thumb two inches into the bowl and in my soup! Gross. 

I'd much rather go up the street to 20th (around there) for pho. Bigger, cleaner, and better pho.
author: Josh M.

description:
I stumbled across this place while wandering around Irving foraging for food... and while it's a total hole in the wall (although that, IMO adds to it's charm), it was the delicious, wafting smell that got me in the door. 

The bbq shrimp and beef packed so much flavor ($6.95) - I've ate my fair share of it at other joints, but I didn't know they could dial it up like that. A pleasant surprise, and definitely worth returning to.
author: angela a.

description: Ok, if you care about the ambiance, than this place isn't for you. But if you care about real tasty Vietnamese food I dare you find a place that will compare! Most definitely best pho in town and believe me I know my pho. Also I have tried Bun Cha Hanoi on the streets of Hanoi and at the markets of Hoi An I can not necessarily confirm that it's any better than a bowl of Loi's. Yes it's that good!
author: Mila Y.

description: I came here with friends and was informed that this place was super small, dirty, and dirt cheap beforehand. I walked in and realized my friends were not joking when they said this place was really small. It was. 8 tables only! Our party of 4 was put in a 6 person table and my friends told me they might give the other 2 seats to others and I was really hoping they wouldn't because it would've been so awkward and not enough space. I ordered Pork BBQ which was not bad but I think I could've done a better job. The pork had a really strong burnt bbq smell. Yes, I know i ordered pork BBQ but it shouldn't have been that strong. In fact, I still smell the burnt bbq breath as I'm typing this post. The tea was just ridiculous. They served it in little plastic tumblers that are for 5 year olds and you would have to ask them to refill it. Seriously? It's the cheap tea that is served in the silver teapot at other restaurants. I recommend washing the utensils in a cup of the hot tea since they were kind of greasy. Btw, my bbq plate cost $5. It was really cheap but I'd rather spend an extra two or three bucks at a place where the food does not reek of burnt bbq and has clean utensils. I believe they do not have a bathroom for customers. My friends noticed I had a disgusted expression throughout the whole meal because I was truly somewhat disgusted. A lot of the noodle soups were $3.95 for a medium. What a deal but seriously you might find this place repulsive. I would only go here if I was extremely hungry and wanted dinner for less than $5. I wanted to give this place 2.5 stars but couldn't. On the bright side, the lady owner was nice but the guy was rude and kept on pushing people to combine tables. He must not realize how awkward that is and how uncomfortable it is since his place is super small.
author: Vivian L.

description: This place is pretty small but the food was really good. Their bowls were pretty cheap, 4 dollars for a medium size! Their soup was really flavorful which is a plus! The bad part about this place is that they charge you take-out boxes and also the workers were pretty rude when we asked for extra lemons! Also there's only like 8 tables in the restaurant and looks a bit dirty and unwelcoming to come in.
author: Stella C.

description: I like vermicelli wiith bbq pork and imperial rolls.  That is the standard dish with which I compare with other Vietnamese restaurant preparations.  This dish has at least five components -  the pork, imperial rolls, vermicelli, vegetables and the fish/dipping sauce.    I thought Loi gave me a decent quantiity of noodles  and the dish came quickly.  The imperials rolls were good, the pork was tasty and plentiful, the vegetables fresh, and the sauce strongly scented.   For the five bucks, a darn good lunch which hit and fulfilled all my caloric, protein, salt, meat, and vegetable needs for the afternoon.   The service was efficient with minimal chit chat -  which is fine since I was there for the food.   If you are in the neighborhood and want an inexpensive meal -   you can't go wrong here, given the price -  but you may have problems squeezing in any more than a group of 4.   enjoy.
author: Wilfred L.

description: "What ...  Did he really?"  These were the first words to wander through my mind walking out of Loi's.  The price of Loi's cannot be beat.  Under $5 for a medium bowl of pho?  Yes please!  The flavor is pretty decent and worthy of 3 stars.  The broth was just mehhh.  It was murky, possibly from constant reheating and recooking.   Why one star you ask?  The service was downright rude.  My friends and I were appalled by the way we were treated.  Don't get me wrong, we weren't expecting anything fancy at all and are used to terrible service.
